# Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>
## Decree No. 63 of 2025
### Regarding the Repeal of the Third Paragraph of Article 41
### of the Decree Issued on April 4, 1979
### Concerning the Civil Service System

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH corresponding to May 10, 2024 AD,
- And Decree-Law No. 15 of 1979 concerning the Civil Service, and its amending laws,
- And the Decree issued on April 4, 1979 concerning the Civil Service System, and its amending decrees,
- And Decree No. 84 of 2024 concerning Ministerial Succession and Delegations, and its amending decrees,
- And based on the presentation of the Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of State for Cabinet Affairs,
- And after the approval of the Council of Ministers,

**We have decreed the following:**

**Article One**
The third paragraph of Article 41 of the aforementioned Decree concerning the Civil Service System shall be repealed.

# Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>
## Announcement <orig>إعلان</orig>
Regarding the issuance of the judgment of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> – dated 25/3/2025 in Case No. (16/2024) Bankruptcy / 3.
Filed by:
1- Tha'er Abdullah Rashid Al-Saif <orig>تائر عبدالله راشد السيف</orig>.
Against:
1- Nasrallah International General Trading Company <orig>شركة نصر الله العالمية للتجارة العامة</orig>.
2- Fatima Abdulwahid Sukkar Nasrallah <orig>فاطمة عبدالواحد سكر نصر الله</orig>.

Head of Bankruptcy Department <orig>رئيس إدارة الإفلاس</orig>

In the Name of His Highness the Amir of Kuwait <orig>صاحب السمو أمير الكويت</orig>
Sheikh Meshal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>الشيخ مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>
General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig>
Bankruptcy Circuit / 3 <orig>دائرة إفلاس / 3</orig>

At the session held publicly at the Court on Tuesday, 25/3/2025 AD.
Presided by Professor: Abdullah Ali Al-Harbi <orig>عبدالله علي الحربي</orig>, Court Agent <orig>وكيل المحكمة</orig>
With the membership of Professor: Mohammed Abdulrahman Al-Nuwaif <orig>محمد عبدالرحمن النويف</orig>, Court Agent <orig>وكيل المحكمة</orig>
And the membership of Professor: Waleed Khalid Al-Rabie <orig>وليد خالد الربيع</orig>, Court Agent <orig>وكيل المحكمة</orig>
And in the presence of Mr.: Yousef Ahmed Al-Bakr <orig>يوسف أحمد البكر</orig>, Session Secretary <orig>أمين سر الجلسة</orig>

(The following judgment was issued)
In Case No.: (16/2024) Bankruptcy Circuit / 3 <orig>دائرة الإفلاس / 3</orig>
Automated Number: 242070020
Filed by:
1- Tha'er Abdullah Rashid Al-Saif <orig>تائر عبدالله راشد السيف</orig>.
Against:
1- Nasrallah International General Trading Company <orig>شركة نصر الله العالمية للتجارة العامة</orig>.
2- Fatima Abdulwahid Sukkar Nasrallah <orig>فاطمة عبدالواحد سكر نصر الله</orig>.

(Reasons)
After hearing the pleadings, reviewing the documents, and deliberating legally:
The facts of the case, the parties' documents, and their defense were previously summarized in the referral decision issued by the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> on 30/5/2024, to which the Court refers to avoid repetition. However, it summarizes them to the necessary extent, as the plaintiff submitted a request to the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> to initiate bankruptcy declaration procedures for the defendants / Nasrallah International General Trading Company <orig>شركة نصر الله العالمية للتجارة العامة</orig>, and Ms. Fatima Abdulwahid Sukkar Nasrallah <orig>فاطمة عبد الواحد سكر نصر الله</orig>; along with the resulting implications.
Based on the premise that he obtained judgment No. 2021/10086 Leases <orig>إيجارات</orig> around 28, issued on 17/5/2022, filed by him against the first defendant company, which ruled for the eviction of the property specified in the lease agreement dated 17/6/2018, and its delivery free of occupants, and that it should pay the plaintiff an amount of 58800 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig> for the period from 1/5/2021 to 30/11/2022, and any new rent at a rate of 8400 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig> monthly starting from 1/12/2021 until full eviction, and obligated it to pay the expenses.

  "page_summary": "This page details a court ruling regarding the bankruptcy of Nasser Allah International Company for General Trade, outlining the legal basis, procedures, and conditions for initiating bankruptcy proceedings according to Kuwaiti law, including the appointment of a trustee and the company's financial status, and the referral of the case to the Bankruptcy Court."
}
</page_metadata>
<header>
Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> Issue 1734, Seventy-First Year
Sunday, 15 Shawwal 1446 AH - 13/4/2025 AD
</header>
KD in exchange for actual legal fees. The judgment became final due to no appeal being filed against it. When the plaintiff commenced execution of this judgment, having executed the part related to eviction, the company did not pay the amount allocated to it, which is KD 178,480, as per the judgment. The plaintiff requested to issue a notice of payment and debt settlement to the defendant company on 5/9/2023, and to the director and partner against whom the claim was filed, Fatima Abdul Wahid Sukkar Nasrallah <orig>فاطمة عبد الواحد سكر نصر الله</orig>, on 16/7/2023. However, they did not make the payment, which prompted him to submit the aforementioned request.

Whereas the request was heard before the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig>, and the plaintiff appeared through his representative and submitted a portfolio of documents including the following: photocopies of the articles of association of Nasrallah International General Trading Company <orig>شركة نصر الله العالمية للتجارة العامة</orig>, a copy of the commercial register extract for Nasrallah International General Trading Company <orig>شركة نصر الله العالمية للتجارة العامة</orig> showing partner and director data, a photocopy of a statement issued by the Execution Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> of the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> indicating the allocated amounts and a list of cases filed against the first defendant company, a photocopy of Judgment No. 2019/5826, Hawally <orig>حولي</orig> Total Rents 7, and a photocopy of the bank accounts of the first defendant company. The defendants were represented by a lawyer who stated that settlement was not possible and requested to proceed with the procedures. On 19/2/2024, the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> was contacted to provide an opinion on the submitted request. The Committee's opinion, dated 19/3/2024, concluded that the Committee was unable to study and prepare a report on the debtor due to the absence of the debtor's financial position, with a proposal to appoint a trustee from the list of licensed auditors <orig>مراقبي الحسابات المرخصين</orig> with the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> to inventory the debtor's assets and properties and prepare an updated financial position, with the trustee's fees estimated based on 40 working hours, totaling KD 2,000. Whereas the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issued his decision dated 28/4/2024 to commence bankruptcy declaration procedures for Nasrallah General Trading Company <orig>شركة نصر الله للتجارة العامة</orig>, setting 17/5/2022 as a provisional date for cessation of payments, publishing and announcing the decision in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>, notifying concerned parties, and appointing Ms. Rabia Ilahiya <orig>رابعه إلهيا</orig> as trustee of the bankruptcy estate. Her fees were estimated at a total of two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> from the date of this decision until the closure of the bankruptcy, and accordingly, she is to inventory the debtor company's assets and properties, take all necessary precautionary measures, and prepare a list of debts and a plan for liquidation and distribution. On 30/5/2024, the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issued his decision (Firstly: referring the documents to the Bankruptcy Court <orig>محكمة الإفلاس</orig> along with the report, in preparation for a judgment regarding the bankruptcy declaration of the first defendant, Nasrallah International General Trading Company <orig>شركة نصر الله العالمية للتجارة العامة</orig>.

In execution of the Bankruptcy Judge's <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decision, the documents were referred to the Bankruptcy Court <orig>محكمة الإفلاس</orig> and registered under the number stated at the beginning of the judgment. The plaintiff appeared through a lawyer representing him, insisting on the requests. The bankruptcy trustee also appeared in person and submitted unsegregated documents, which the Court reviewed, consisting of a report regarding the bankruptcy of the first defendant company. Upon the Court's review, it was found that the defendant company has no assets except for an account in Gulf Bank <orig>بنك الخليج</orig> containing KD 52.267 (fifty-two Dinars and 267 Fils). The Court decided to reserve the case for judgment at today's session.

Whereas regarding the subject of the request submitted by the plaintiff, it is stipulated in Article 1 of Bankruptcy Law No. 71/2020 <orig>قانون الإفلاس رقم 2020/71</orig> that "In the application of this Law, the following words and phrases shall have the meaning indicated opposite each of them... Financial Imbalance: The debtor's funds are insufficient to pay his debts."

It is also stipulated in Article 2 of the same Law that "The provisions of this Law shall apply to: 1- Every natural person proven to have the status of a merchant. 2- Kuwaiti companies and branches of foreign companies, with the exception of joint ventures." ...3. It is stipulated in the first paragraph of Article 13 of the same Law that "The debtor may submit a request to the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> to commence preventive settlement procedures, restructuring, or bankruptcy declaration within a maximum period of two months from the date of cessation of payments or from the date on which he obtained information suggesting that he will be unable to pay his debts when they fall due, unless any of the creditors or regulatory bodies have submitted a request to commence procedures within the aforementioned period. Failure to submit the request within the deadlines specified in this paragraph shall not result in the inadmissibility of the request."

It is stipulated in Article 131 of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig> that "Subject to the provisions stipulated in this Law regarding the request to commence procedures, as well as the cases specified in the chapter on preventive settlement and the chapter on restructuring, in which the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> may issue a decision to commence bankruptcy declaration procedures, the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> shall issue his decision to commence bankruptcy declaration procedures if the following conditions are met: 1- The debtor has ceased payments. 2- There is a financial imbalance in the debtor's financial position. 3- The debtor's business is not viable for continuity."

It is stipulated in Article 132 of the same Law that "In all cases where the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issues his decision to commence bankruptcy declaration procedures, the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall refer the file of the request to commence procedures to the Bankruptcy Court <orig>محكمة الإفلاس</orig> within ten days from the date the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issues the decision to commence bankruptcy declaration procedures. A report on the procedures taken regarding the request from its submission until the issuance of the decision to commence procedures shall be deposited in the file, along with a statement of the factual and legal grounds for the decision."
<page_end>3</page_end>

Article 172 of the same law stipulates that "a state of bankruptcy shall not arise except by a judgment declaring bankruptcy. The Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall, within ten days from the date of the bankruptcy declaration judgment, announce its operative part, publish it, disclose it on the Kuwait Stock Exchange / Boursa Kuwait <orig>بورصة الكويت للأوراق المالية</orig> if the debtor is listed therein, instruct the debtor to disclose it on their website, and register it as specified in Article 33 of this law. It shall also, within ten days from the date of that judgment, publish and announce its summary."
It is established that "a Limited Liability Company <orig>الشركة ذات المسئولية المحدودة</orig> has its own independent financial liability separate from that of its partners. Consequently, the managing director representing this company has their own independent personal financial liability, and their liability for damage caused to third parties is a tort liability <orig>مسئولية تقصيرية</orig> that is established by proving the director's fault and the existence of a causal link <orig>رابطة السببية</orig> between this fault and the actual damage."
(Appeal No. 1022/2003 Commercial, Session 30/6/2024)
It is established that "companies acquire a legal personality <orig>شخصيتها المعنوية</orig> independent of the persons of their partners, and a consequence of this is that they have an independent and separate financial liability <orig>ذمة مالية مستقلة ومنفصلة</orig> from the liabilities of their partners."
(Appeal No. 1053/2004 Commercial, Session 11/6/2005)
It is established that "the trial court <orig>محكمة الموضوع</orig> has full authority <orig>السلطة التامة</orig> to ascertain the facts of the case from its documents and papers, and from the evidence and presumptions presented. It may infer from the facts of the case and the conduct of the litigants the presumptions upon which it bases its conviction, provided that its inference is sound <orig>استنباطها سائغاً</orig> and supported by evidence and grounds <orig>شواهد وأسانيد</orig> that are firmly established in the papers and lead to the conclusion it reached. The court may intervene if the conclusion it drew from those facts does not comply with its legal requirements <orig>موجباتها قانوناً</orig>."
(Appeal No. 704/2000 Commercial, Session 11/2/2002)
Regarding the request for the declaration of bankruptcy of the First Defendant, Nasrallah International General Trading Company <orig>شركة نصر الله العالمية للتجارة العامة</orig>, since the Court found that it ceased payment of its outstanding debt <orig>المديونية المترصدة</orig> and it was not evident that it had any balance sheets or assets to show its financial position, and the debt was established against it by a final judicial judgment <orig>حكم قضائي نهائي</orig> which obligated the First Defendant to pay the claimed amount, in addition to the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> having issued a decision to commence bankruptcy declaration proceedings <orig>افتتاح إجراءات شهر الإفلاس</orig> and considering May 17, 2022, as the date of cessation of payment, which is the date of the final judgment issued against it, the Court therefore concludes that there was a financial deficit <orig>عجز في المركز المالي</orig> in the financial position of the First Defendant company, which resulted in the cessation of payment and the non-viability of the company's operations for continuity. Accordingly, based on the foregoing, the plaintiff's request for the declaration of bankruptcy of the defendant company is based on a correct foundation, necessitating a judgment in its favor, as will be stated in the operative part.
Regarding the request for the declaration of bankruptcy of the Second Defendant, Fatima Abdul Wahid Sukkar Nasrallah <orig>فاطمة عبد الواحد سكر نصر الله</orig>, since it was established to the Court that the First Defendant company is a Limited Liability Company <orig>شركة ذات مسئولية محدودة</orig> and the Second Defendant was a partner in it, and the provisions of the law have stipulated that a partner in a Limited Liability Company is not liable for the company's obligations except to the extent of their share in the capital, and the company's director is not liable for the company's obligations except in the event of their violation of the provisions of the law or the company's articles of association or error in management, which was not found in the papers. And since the plaintiff submitted a request for her bankruptcy in her capacity as the owner of the aforementioned First Defendant company, their request is based on an incorrect foundation, because the company has a legal personality <orig>شخصية معنوية</orig> and an independent financial liability <orig>ذمة مالية مستقلة</orig> separate from that of the Second Defendant. Therefore, it is necessary to rule to reject their request for these reasons, without explicitly stating it in the operative part.
Regarding the expenses, including legal fees <orig>أتعاب المحاماة</orig>, the Court obligates the defendant to pay them in accordance with the provisions of Article 1/119 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> and Article 23 of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>.
(For these reasons)
### The Court ruled:
To declare the bankruptcy of the First Defendant, Nasrallah International General Trading Company <orig>شركة نصر الله العالمية للتجارة العامة</orig>, and to set May 17, 2022, as the provisional date for cessation of payment. The Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall register this judgment in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> and publish its summary in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> according to the procedures followed in this regard, and to add the expenses and an amount of ten Dinars <orig>عشرة دنانير</orig> for legal fees to be borne by the bankruptcy estate <orig>التفليسة</orig>.

(Reasons)
After hearing the pleadings, reviewing the documents, and deliberating legally:
Whereas the facts of the lawsuit and the documents of the two plaintiffs were previously obtained by the referral decision issued by the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> on 30/5/2024 in Application No. (19/2022 Declaration of Bankruptcy <orig>شهر إفلاس</orig>), to which the Court refers to avoid repetition, but it summarizes them to the necessary extent that the two plaintiffs submitted an application to commence bankruptcy declaration proceedings <orig>إجراءات شهر إفلاسهما</orig>, based on the fact that they are indebted to the defendants by virtue of several judgments and bank checks <orig>شيكات بنكية</orig> on different dates, and that they have ceased payment of debt in their financial position, and therefore the two plaintiffs had the right to submit an application to commence bankruptcy declaration proceedings against them, hence the lawsuit.
And whereas the application was considered before the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig>, and on 19/12/2022, he issued his decision to address the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> to examine the availability of the substantive conditions thereof as stated in the decision, to which the Court refers to avoid repetition.
And in implementation of the Bankruptcy Judge's <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decision, the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> submitted its Report No. 13 dated 26/3/2023, in which it concluded that "the continuation of the company's activity is futile due to negative financial results, therefore it is in the interest of the creditors to declare their bankruptcy <orig>إشهار إفلاسهما</orig> and appoint a trustee <orig>أمين</orig> to sell the company's assets and stop the waste of company assets, with a proposal to take the following precautionary measures: - promptly appoint an inventory trustee <orig>أمين حصر</orig> and seize the company's assets - promptly stop administrative and general expenses. - impose restrictions on the two debtors in disposing of their funds and assets. The trustee's fees were estimated at 4000 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>".
And after the submission of the Bankruptcy Committee's <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> report, the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issued his decision on 27/5/2024 to: 1- commence bankruptcy declaration proceedings <orig>إجراءات شهر إفلاس</orig> for both: 1- Winsy General Trading and Contracting Company (W.L.L.) <orig>شركة وينسي للتجارة العامة والمقاولات ذ.م.م</orig>. 2- Mohammed Younis Zattam <orig>محمد يونس زطام</orig>, and to set the date of this decision as a temporary date for cessation of payment, and to publish and announce the decision in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and notify the concerned parties. 2- appoint Professor/ Ali Owaid Rakhees Awad <orig>علي عويد رخيص عوض</orig> as trustee <orig>أميناً</orig> for the bankruptcy estate <orig>التفليسة</orig>, and his fees were estimated at 4000 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig> from the date of this decision until the closure of the bankruptcy estate, and he is required to prepare a list of debts and a liquidation and distribution plan.
And on 30/5/2024, the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> also issued his decision to refer the bankruptcy declaration application documents in their current state to the Bankruptcy Court <orig>محكمة الإفلاس</orig> along with the report regarding the defendant Aayan Real Estate Company <orig>شركة أعيان العقارية</orig>, and he insisted on his previous defense.
And a representative for the defendant Adnan Al-Saleh Commercial Group <orig>مجموعة عدنان الصالح التجارية</orig> appeared and requested
a postponement for review.

None of the remaining defendant parties appeared despite being legally notified.
Whereas the court decided to reserve the case for judgment at today's session.
And whereas, regarding the subject matter, it is stipulated in Article 1 of Bankruptcy Law No. 71/2020 <orig>قانون الإفلاس رقم 71/2020</orig> that "For the purpose of applying this Law, the following words and phrases shall have the meanings assigned to each of them ...... Financial Imbalance: The debtor's funds are insufficient to pay his debts."
And it is stipulated in Article 2 of the same Law that "The provisions of this Law shall apply to: 1- Every natural person proven to be a merchant. 2- Kuwaiti companies and branches of foreign companies, with the exception of joint ventures. (... 3
And it is stipulated in the first paragraph of Article 13 of the same Law that "The debtor may submit a request to the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> for the commencement of preventive settlement, restructuring, or bankruptcy declaration procedures within a maximum period of two months from the date of cessation of payment or from the date on which he had information indicating that he would be unable to pay his debts when due, unless any of the creditors or regulatory bodies have submitted a request for the commencement of procedures within the aforementioned period, and failure to submit the request within the deadlines specified in this paragraph shall not result in the rejection of the request."
And it is stipulated in the first paragraph of Article 3 of Ministerial Decision No. 31 of 2022 <orig>القرار الوزاري رقم 31 لسنة 2022</orig> regarding the amendment of some provisions of the Executive Regulations of Law No. 71/2020 <orig>القانون رقم 71/2020</orig> issuing the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig> that "The debtor may submit a request to the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> for the commencement of preventive settlement, restructuring, or bankruptcy declaration procedures within a maximum period of two months from the date of cessation of payment or from the date on which a financial imbalance occurred in his position or from the date on which he had information indicating that he would be unable to pay his debts when due, or that a financial imbalance would occur in his position, provided that the indebtedness for which the debtor ceased or is expected to cease payment is not less than K.D. 10,000 (ten thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), and also provided that the amount of the actual or expected financial imbalance is not less than the aforementioned amount, unless any of the creditors or regulatory bodies have submitted a request for the commencement of procedures within the aforementioned period."
And it is stipulated in Article 131 of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig> that "Subject to the provisions stipulated in this Law regarding the request for the commencement of procedures, as well as the cases in preparation for the judgment declaring the bankruptcy of the applicant/ Mohammed Younis Zimam <orig>محمد يونس زمام</orig> and Wensi General Trading and Contracting Company (LLC) <orig>شركة وينسي للتجارة العامة والمقاولات ( ذ.م.م)</orig>, with the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> being tasked with determining the circuit and the specific session for its consideration and notifying the concerned parties thereof."
In execution of the decision of the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig>, the papers were referred to the present circuit and registered under its current number.
Upon reviewing the case as indicated in the session minutes, at the session on 26/11/2024, a representative for the defendants appeared and submitted a memorandum requesting, at its conclusion, a judgment: declaring the bankruptcy of the two plaintiffs and setting the date of their cessation of payment as 27/5/2023, with the judgment being enforceable against all defendants in accordance with the letter from the Bankruptcy Court <orig>محكمة الإفلاس</orig> issued to the court on 30/5/2024, and including immediate enforcement of the judgment. A representative for the defendant Aayan Real Estate Company <orig>شركة أعيان العقارية</orig> appeared and submitted a portfolio of documents, the most important of which included (a copy of the judgment in Case No. 2021/1577 Misdemeanors – 2022/16 Conciliation). A representative for the defendant Al-Sayer Facilities Company <orig>شركة تسهيلات الساير</orig> appeared and requested a postponement for review. A representative for the defendant Adnan Al-Saleh Group <orig>مجموعة عدنان الصالح</orig> appeared and requested a postponement for review. A representative for the defendant Agyal Entertainment Real Estate Company <orig>شركة أجيال الترفيه العقارية</orig> appeared and requested a postponement for review.
At the session on 24/12/2024, a representative for the plaintiffs appeared and insisted on the requests. A representative for the second defendant (Al-Sayer Facilities General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة تسهيلات الساير للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig>) appeared and submitted a portfolio of documents which included (a copy of the statement of claim No. 2024/13048 Commercial Full/45, a copy of a request for an order of payment based on a promissory note for the amount of three hundred thirty-five thousand two hundred Dinars <orig>دينار</orig> dated 7/2/2019). A representative for the sixth defendant (Adnan Al-Saleh Commercial Group <orig>مجموعة عدنان الصالح التجارية</orig>) appeared and submitted a portfolio of documents, the most important of which included (a copy of the judgment in Case No. 2021/2895 Rents Full Al-Ahmadi/5 <orig>إيجارات كلي الأحمدي/5</orig>, a copy of the judgment in Appeal No. 2021/546 Rents/1 <orig>إيجارات/1</orig>). A representative for Aayan Real Estate Company <orig>شركة أعيان العقارية</orig> appeared and requested a judgment dismissing the case.
At the session on 4/3/2025, the representative for the two plaintiffs appeared and stated that he was not waiving the litigation against Aayan Real Estate Company <orig>شركة أعيان العقارية</orig> and that he had filed a new statement of claim including it among the defendants, and he presented a copy of the statement of claim, which he announced to those present, requesting at its conclusion a judgment: declaring the bankruptcy of the two plaintiffs against the defendants and setting the date of their cessation of payment as 27/5/2023 according to the report of the bankruptcy trustee <orig>أمين التفليسة</orig>, with the judgment being enforceable against all defendants and including immediate enforcement of the judgment. And whereas regarding the request to include the judgment with immediate enforcement without bail, the judgments issued by the Bankruptcy Court <orig>محكمة الإفلاس</orig> in accordance with the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig> are enforceable, and there is no need to state that in the operative part of the judgment.
And whereas regarding the comprehensive expenses for legal fees, since the bankruptcy case <orig>دعوى الإفلاس</orig> is a procedural case based on guaranteeing the rights of creditors, therefore, the Court rules to add them to the bankruptcy estate <orig>التفليسة</orig>, in accordance with the provisions of Article 1/119 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> and Article 189, paragraph (c) of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>.
(For these reasons)
The Court ruled: -
To declare the bankruptcy of both plaintiffs:
1- Wensi General Trading and Contracting Company W.L.L. <orig>شركة وينسي للتجارة العامة والمقاولات ذ.م.م.</orig>
2- Mohammed Younis Rattām <orig>محمد يونس رطام</orig>, and to set May 27, 2024, as the provisional date for cessation of payments, and the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall register this judgment in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig>, publish its summary in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>, and announce it according to the procedures followed in this regard, and take all necessary legal measures concerning their bankruptcy declaration, and added the expenses and an amount of twenty Dinars <orig>دينار</orig> for legal fees to the bankruptcy estate <orig>التفليسة</orig>.
Session Secretary
Court Agent
as stipulated in the chapter on preventive settlement <orig>التسوية الوقائية</orig> and the chapter on restructuring <orig>إعادة الهيكلة</orig>, in which the bankruptcy judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> may issue a decision to commence bankruptcy declaration procedures. The bankruptcy judge issues his decision to commence bankruptcy declaration procedures if the following conditions are met: 1- The debtor <orig>المدين</orig> has ceased payments. 2- There is a deficit in the debtor's financial position. 3- The debtor's business is not viable for continuity."
And it is stipulated in Article 132 of the same law that "In all cases where the bankruptcy judge issues his decision to commence bankruptcy declaration procedures, the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall refer the bankruptcy commencement application file to the Bankruptcy Court <orig>محكمة الإفلاس</orig> within ten days from the date the bankruptcy judge issues his decision to commence bankruptcy declaration procedures, and a report on the procedures taken regarding the application from its submission until the issuance of the decision to commence procedures shall be deposited in the file, along with a statement of the factual and legal grounds for the decision."
And it is stipulated in Article 172 of the same law that "The state of bankruptcy <orig>حالة الإفلاس</orig> shall not arise except by a judgment declaring bankruptcy, and the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall, within ten days from the date of the bankruptcy declaration judgment, announce its operative part, publish it, and disclose it on the Boursa Kuwait <orig>بورصة الكويت للأوراق المالية</orig> if the debtor <orig>المدين</orig> is listed therein, and instruct the debtor to disclose it on his website and register it as stipulated in Article 33 of this Law, and shall also, within ten days from the date of that judgment, publish its summary and announce it."
Furthermore, it is stipulated in Article 254 of the same law that "The provisions of this Law shall generally apply to preventive settlement <orig>التسوية الوقائية</orig>, restructuring <orig>إعادة الهيكلة</orig>, and bankruptcy declaration procedures submitted concerning corporate debts....."
And it is established that "The trial court <orig>حكمة الموضوع</orig> has full authority to ascertain the facts of the case from its documents, papers, and the evidence and presumptions presented, and it may infer from the facts of the case and the conduct of the litigants the presumptions upon which it relies in forming its conviction, provided that its inference is reasonable and supported by evidence and grounds firmly established in the documents and leading to the conclusion it reached, and the Court of Cassation <orig>حكمة التمييز</orig> may intervene if the conclusion drawn from those facts is not in accordance with legal requirements."
(Appeal No. 704/2000 Commercial, Session of 11/2/2002)
Given the foregoing, and as it is established from the documents that the two plaintiffs submitted a request for bankruptcy declaration due to their cessation of payment of the debt owed to each of the defendants by virtue of judgments and bank checks, and the amount of the debt exceeded the amount specified by the Executive Regulations of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>, and also that

*   Decree-Law No. (67) of 1980 promulgating the Civil Code.
*   Law No. (1) of 1993 concerning the Protection of Public Funds.
*   Article (22) of Law No. 106 of 2013 concerning Combating Money Laundering and Terrorist Financing.
*   Article (36) of Law No. 2 of 2016 concerning the Establishment of the Public Anti-Corruption Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig> and Provisions for Financial Disclosure.
*   Decision of the Public Prosecutor <orig>النائب العام</orig> No. (2025/17) in Case No. (2022/90) regarding Money Laundering Restriction.

- Decided -
### Article One
Agents for the management of seized funds (real estate) appointed in accordance with the provisions of Article (24) of Law No. (1) of 1993, referred to above, shall adhere to the following controls in performing their assigned tasks:
1.  The agent shall, in performing their task, adhere to all obligations of an agent in accordance with the provisions of Chapter Two of Part Three of Decree-Law No. (67) of 1980, referred to above, provided that it does not conflict with the provisions stipulated in this decision or with future decisions issued by the President of the State Audit Bureau <orig>ديوان المحاسبة</orig>.
2.  The agent shall preserve the funds (real estate) entrusted to their management and must exercise the care of an ordinary person in doing so, as required by the aforementioned agency provisions.
3.  The agent may not delegate all or part of their task to anyone except with written permission from the Public Prosecutor <orig>النائب العام</orig>.
4.  The agent's authority is limited to management acts, and they may not undertake any disposition that is not a management act except with written permission from the Public Prosecutor <orig>النائب العام</orig>.
5.  The agent may not use the seized funds (real estate) for their own benefit, and it is risky for them to deal with the seized persons.
6.  The agent must refer to the Public Prosecutor <orig>النائب العام</orig>, as appropriate, regarding all requests or grievances presented to them concerning the seized funds (real estate) that are prohibited from disposition.
7.  The agent must disclose any conflicts of interest between themselves and the seized funds (real estate), as well as between themselves and the seized persons.
8.  The agent must submit to the Public Prosecutor <orig>النائب العام</orig> every three months an accurate statement of the assigned tasks, including the financial position and supplementary explanations, a statement of revenues and expenditures for the period covered by the statement, a cumulative statement from the start of management until the end of this period, a cash flow statement, and a comprehensive administrative report on dispositions related to the management of the seized funds (real estate). A copy of the foregoing shall be submitted to the President of the State Audit Bureau <orig>ديوان المحاسبة</orig> within fifteen days following the end of each period, and the Bureau shall notify the Public Prosecutor <orig>النائب العام</orig> and the agent of any observations it deems necessary.
9.  The agent shall continue their management duties until the case is decided or a decision is issued to lift the seizure on the seized funds (real estate).
10. If the agent wishes to terminate their agency, or if their agency terminates for any reason, they must complete the tasks they have started to a degree that no harm is feared to the funds (real estate) managed by them.

### Article Two
The President of the State Audit Bureau <orig>ديوان المحاسبة</orig> may issue a decision with special additional controls for the performance of some agents' work in cases that necessitate it from seizure cases, according to the requirements of the interest of the funds (real estate) under management.

### Article Three
This decision shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and shall come into force from the day following its publication. All concerned parties shall implement it, each within their respective jurisdiction.

<footer>
President of the State Audit Bureau <orig>ديوان المحاسبة</orig>
Essam Salem Al-Roumi <orig>عصام سالم الرومي</orig>
Issued on: 12 Shawwal 1446 AH
Corresponding to: 10 April 2025 AD

# Ministry of Higher Education <orig>وزارة التعليم العالي</orig>
## Ministerial Decision No. (2025/96)
### Regarding the amendment of the name of Manhattan College
in the United States of America on the lists of
the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Quality Assurance of Education <orig>الجهاز الوطني للاعتماد الأكاديمي وضمان جودة التعليم</orig>
*   Having reviewed Decree-Law No. 15 of 1979 concerning Civil Service and its amending laws.
*   And Amiri Decree No. (417) of 2010 issued on October 25, 2010, concerning the establishment of the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Quality Assurance of Education <orig>الجهاز الوطني للاعتماد الأكاديمي وضمان جودة التعليم</orig>.
*   And Ministerial Decision No. (272) issued on October 3, 2012, concerning allowing Kuwaiti students to enroll for study outside the State of Kuwait only in universities for which a ministerial decision is issued by the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Quality Assurance of Education <orig>الجهاز الوطني للاعتماد الأكاديمي وضمان جودة التعليم</orig>.
*   And Academic Decision No. (2014/25) issued on June 3, 2014, concerning allowing study in Bachelor's and Postgraduate programs in the United States of America.
*   And the decision of the Board of Directors of the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Quality Assurance of Education <orig>الجهاز الوطني للاعتماد الأكاديمي وضمان جودة التعليم</orig> No. (7) issued on December 31, 2014, which includes the mechanism for issuing decisions related to identifying higher education institutions outside the State of Kuwait whose graduates' qualifications are allowed to be accredited.
*   And the decision of the Board of Directors of the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Quality Assurance of Education <orig>الجهاز الوطني للاعتماد الأكاديمي وضمان جودة التعليم</orig> (2014/5) concerning the determination of criteria for selecting higher education institutions outside the State of Kuwait.
*   And based on the letter from the Cultural Office in Washington dated January 30, 2025.
*   And based on the recommendation of the Committee for Proposing Standards, Reviewing, and Updating Lists of Higher Education Institutions outside the State of Kuwait in its third meeting held on March 11, 2025.
*   And based on the proposal of the Director General of the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Quality Assurance of Education <orig>الجهاز الوطني للاعتماد الأكاديمي وضمان جودة التعليم</orig>.
*   And as required by the public interest.

(It has been decided)
## Article One
The name of Manhattan College shall be amended to Manhattan University, as stated in Academic Decision No. (2014/25) issued on June 3, 2014, concerning the list of higher education institutions allowed for enrollment to study Bachelor's and Postgraduate programs in the United States of America.

## Article Two
This decision shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.

Minister of Higher Education and Scientific Research
Dr. Nader Abdullah Mohammed Al-Jalal <orig>د. نادر عبد الله محمد الجلال</orig>

Issued on: 4 Shawwal 1446 AH
Corresponding to: 2 April 2025 AD

# Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>
## Resolution No. (58) of 2025
Regarding the Registration of Mr. Adel Mohammed Abdul Hassan Al-Sanea <orig>عادل محمد عبد الحسن الصانع</orig> in the Special Register of Auditors
After reviewing:
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the regulation of securities activities, its executive regulations, and their amendments.
- And the request of Mr. Adel Mohammed Abdul Hassan Al-Sanea <orig>عادل محمد عبد الحسن الصانع</orig> regarding his registration as an auditor in the special register at the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>.
- And based on Resolution No. (4) of 2025 regarding the amendment of final approval powers for the work procedures of the Supervision Sector, issued on 12/01/2025.
It was decided as follows:
### Article One
Mr. Adel Mohammed Abdul Hassan Al-Sanea <orig>عادل محمد عبد الحسن الصانع</orig> shall be registered as an auditor in the special register at the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>.
### Article Two
The registration period for the aforementioned auditor shall be three years, starting from the date of issuance of the registration certificate, after payment of the prescribed fees.
The aforementioned auditor is obligated to pay the fee upon renewal of registration for any other period in accordance with the provisions of Law No. 7 of 2010, its executive regulations, their amendments, and the resolutions and instructions of the Authority.
### Article Three
The competent authorities shall implement this decision as it pertains to them, and it shall be effective from the date of its issuance and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

## Announcement of Tender
### Practice No. 1-2026/2025
The Ministry of Awqaf and Islamic Affairs <orig>وزارة الشئون الإسلامية</orig> announces the tender for Practice No. 1-2026/2025, concerning the withdrawal of sewage water from several rounds for mosques affiliated with the Ministry of Awqaf and Islamic Affairs <orig>وزارة الشئون الإسلامية</orig> (a coverage service provision contract), in accordance with the following terms and data:
<table_caption>Tender Details for Ministry of Awqaf and Islamic Affairs</table_caption>
<table>
| Tender Submission | Closing Date | Practice Purchase Fee Value | Public Envelope Opening Meeting |
|:------|:--------|:---|:---|
| 13/4/2025 | 1:00 PM on Sunday, 4/5/2025 | 75 K.D. (Kuwaiti Dinar <orig>د.ك</orig>) | 2:00 PM on Sunday, 4/5/2025, at the meeting room attached to the office of the Assistant Undersecretary for Administrative and Financial Affairs – 6th Floor |
</table>

- Practice documents can be obtained from the Tenders Department <orig>قسم المناقصات</orig> at the Financial Affairs Directorate <orig>إدارة الشئون المالية</orig> – 6th Floor, Ministry of Awqaf and Islamic Affairs <orig>وزارة الشئون الإسلامية</orig> building in Al-Riqqa Area <orig>منطقة الرقعي</orig>, during official working hours.
- Last day for submitting inquiries: end of working hours on Sunday, 27/4/2025.
- Bids shall be submitted to the Tenders Department <orig>قسم المناقصات</orig> with an initial security deposit in favor of the Ministry of Awqaf and Islamic Affairs <orig>وزارة الشئون الإسلامية</orig> in the amount of 1500 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, in the form of a certified check or an accredited letter of guarantee from one of the local banks in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>. The submitted security deposit must be valid for 90 days from the date of envelope opening.
- Any bid not accompanied by the original initial security deposit, or if the value or duration of the security deposit is less than required, will be excluded.
- All companies participating in the practice are invited to attend the envelope opening at the time and place specified in the table above.
Notes:
1. The following conditions apply to anyone submitting a bid for this practice:
- Must be registered with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> as well as the Ministry of Awqaf and Islamic Affairs <orig>وزارة الشئون الإسلامية</orig>.
- Submission of a valid 'To Whom It May Concern' certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> stating that there are no restrictions on the company's files regarding government contracts registered with the Authority.
2. All bid documents must be submitted on a CD or non-copyable electronic flash drives (3 copies), in addition to submitting hard copies of the bid format, price schedules, and the original initial security deposit.
3. The tendering of practices and tenders by the Ministry of Awqaf and Islamic Affairs <orig>وزارة الشئون الإسلامية</orig> and any other works announced by the Ministry can be followed via the following link:
https://tenders.awqaf.gov.kw

# Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig>
## Announcement
Regarding the Tax Assessment for Assist B.V. B.V. <orig>اسيست بي في بي اي</orig>
Income Tax for Assist B.V. B.V. <orig>اسيست بي في بي اي</orig> for the Fiscal Year Ending 31/12/2015 - Registration No.: 160687
After reviewing your tax declaration submitted for the aforementioned fiscal year, and since the company does not maintain the accounting books and records required by the provisions of Income Tax Decree No. 3 of 1955, as amended by Law No. 2 of 2008, and Article (15) of the Executive Regulations, the Ministry has decided, based on Article (19) of the Executive Regulations, not to rely on your business results and to estimate your profits at 30% of the revenues, as follows:

<table_caption>Tax Assessment for Assist B.V. B.V. (2015)</table_caption>
<table>
| Kuwaiti Dinar <orig>الدينار كويتي</orig> |
|:---|
| Revenues according to Tax Declaration |
| 102,334       |
| Net Profit 30% |
| 30,700        |
| Tax Due 15% |
| 4,605         |
</table>

We hope you will promptly pay the amount due of K.D. 4,605 (only four thousand six hundred and five Kuwaiti Dinars). We refer to the provision of Article Eight of Income Tax Decree No. 3 of 1955, as amended by Law No. 2 of 2008, which stipulates a penalty of 1% for every thirty days or part thereof in case of delay in payment, and Article (24) of the Executive Regulations regarding objection to the tax assessment, which stipulates that a tax objection submitted by the company shall not be considered after sixty days from the date of notification of the assessment letter..

Undersecretary of the Ministry of Finance <orig>وكيل وزارة المالية</orig>

# Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>
## Announcement of Factory Sale
The Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> - General Department of Enforcement <orig>الإدارة العامة للتنفيذ</orig> - Capital Governorate <orig>محافظة العاصمة</orig> - Enforcement File No. (200257630), announces that on Tuesday, 27/05/2025, starting from 10:00 AM, the entire factory known by the trade name "Green Carbon Factory <orig>مصنع جرين كربون</orig>" for the production of liquefied carbon dioxide gas, Industrial Establishment License No. (11960) issued by the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> on 14/12/2011, located in Shuaiba Industrial Area (Eastern) <orig>منطقة الشعيبية الصناعية (الشرقية)</orig> - Plot No. (16) of Block No. (2) with an area of 20000m², will be sold by public auction. This is in execution of Judgment No. 2020/2384 Commercial Appeal Debtor Government/9 <orig>استئناف تجاري مدين حكومة/9</orig> dated 16/02/2021, which became final by virtue of the Consultative Chamber's decision at the Court of Cassation <orig>محكمة التمييز</orig> No. 2021/1277 Commercial Cassation/2 <orig>تمييز تجاري/2</orig> dated 16/10/2022, and mortgaged in favor of the Industrial Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت الصناعي</orig> (Mortgagee Creditor) by virtue of Loan Agreement documented under No. 2368 Vol. 3 <orig>جلد 3</orig> on 23/09/2012, and Banking Facilities Agreement documented under No. 612 Vol. 3 <orig>جلد 3</orig> on 28/04/2012, and Loan Agreement documented under No. 649 Vol. 3 <orig>جلد 3</orig> on 08/04/2015, considering it established with all its material and moral components and elements, in fulfillment of the bank's debt owed by the debtor/Green Carbon General Trading Co. W.L.L. <orig>شركة جرين كربون للتجارة العامة ذ.م.م</orig> in the amount of K.D. 12,377,302.008 (twelve million three hundred seventy-seven thousand three hundred two Kuwaiti Dinars and eight fils) as of 21/11/2018, in addition to expenses and interest from that date until full payment. The sale will take place at the factory premises in accordance with the procedures stipulated in Article (44) of the Commercial Law <orig>قانون التجارة</orig>. If this day is not sufficient to complete the sale, it will be completed on the following three days, noting that the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> (the Authority) does not object to the transfer of the aforementioned industrial license and its associated benefits, including the right to the plot on which the factory is built, to the successful bidder, after the bidder pays the Authority the financial amounts due for the said plot.
Therefore, those wishing to purchase should proceed to the Capital Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة تنفيذ العاصمة</orig> to obtain the necessary entry permits, no later than one week from the date of publication of this announcement - Phone: 97485862. For more information, the General Department of Enforcement <orig>الإدارة العامة للتنفيذ</orig> - Capital Governorate <orig>محافظة العاصمة</orig> can be consulted during official working hours. This announcement is made for clarification.

Head of Capital Governorate Enforcement Department <orig>رئيس إدارة تنفيذ محافظة العاصمة</orig>

### Announcement
The esteemed owners of the company: Dar Al-Fanajeen for Hotel and Restaurant Supplies <orig>دار الفناجين للتجهيزات الفندقية والمطاعم</orig>##Company Under Liquidation
have submitted a request to the Department of Partnerships <orig>إدارة شركات الأشخاص</orig> at the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> to carry out: dissolution and liquidation of the company. The legal entity is a Limited Liability Company <orig>شركة ذات مسؤولية محدودة</orig>.
Anyone with an objection is requested to submit it to the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> within thirty days from the date of publication of this announcement, in accordance with the usual procedures for filing a lawsuit. The submission of an objection shall result in the continued obligation of the joint partners <orig>الشركاء المتضامنين</orig> in the case of a general partnership <orig>التضامنية</orig> or simple limited partnership <orig>التوصية البسيطة</orig> only, in the face of this creditor, until their objection is decided by a judicial ruling.

### Announcement
**A request has been submitted by the owners of Dar Al Arab International General Trading Company <orig>شركة / دار العرب انترناشيونال للتجارة العامة</orig>.## Company Under Liquidation**
A request has been submitted to the Department of Personal Companies <orig>إدارة شركات الأشخاص</orig> at the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> to carry out: dissolution and liquidation of the company. The legal entity is a One-Person Company <orig>شركة الشخص الواحد</orig>.
Anyone with an objection is requested to submit it to the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> within thirty days from the date of publication of this announcement, in accordance with the usual procedures for filing a lawsuit. The submission of an objection shall result in the continued obligation of the joint partners <orig>الشركاء المتضامنين</orig> in the case of a general partnership <orig>التضامنية</orig> or a simple limited partnership <orig>التوصية البسيطة</orig> only in relation to this creditor until a final judgment is rendered on their objection.

At the conclusion of the meeting, Mr. Sulaiman Abdullah Sulaiman Al-Ajmi <orig>سليمان عبدالله سليمان العجمي</orig> - Chairman of the Session - thanked the attendees, and accordingly, the ordinary general assembly meeting of Al-Dhaman Takaful Insurance Company K.S.C.C. <orig>شركة الضمان للتأمين التكافلي ش.م.ك.م.</orig> concluded at 1:00 PM on the same day.

### Public Shareholding Company
The Extraordinary General Assembly of the shareholders of Kuwait Hotels Company <orig>شركة الفنادق الكويتية</orig> - a Kuwaiti Shareholding Company - held its thirty-third meeting at 12:00 PM on Thursday, March 27, 2025, at the company's headquarters located in Al-Subaih <orig>الصبيح</orig> area, Kuwait Hotels Company <orig>شركة الفنادق الكويتية</orig> building - First Floor.

- Mr. Ahmed Hussein <orig>أحمد حسين</orig> - Executive Director of Financial Affairs

# Gas and Oil Fields Services Company (K.S.C.C.) <orig>شركة خدمات حقول الغاز والنفط (ش.م.ك.م)</orig>
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
### Held on Wednesday, March 26, 2025

The Extraordinary General Assembly of the shareholders of Gas and Oil Fields Services Company <orig>شركة خدمات حقول الغاز والنفط</orig> – a Kuwaiti Shareholding Company (Closed) – was held on Wednesday, March 26, 2025, at 1:00 PM, at the company's headquarters in East Ahmadi <orig>شرق الأحمدي</orig> area – Plot 6, Street (1). This meeting was held with the aim of regularizing the company's status and aligning the articles of the Memorandum of Association and Articles of Association with Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 and its Executive Regulations.

The meeting session was chaired by the Chairman of the Company's Board of Directors, Mr. Ali Talib Muqeem <orig>علي طالب مقيم</orig>. Shareholder attendance was recorded at the appointed time, with the percentage of shares represented at the meeting reaching 100% of the company's total capital.

Number of Shareholders Present:
*   Attendance Rate: 100%
*   Number of Proxies: 7

After the announcement of the quorum for the validity of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting, the Chairman of the session opened the meeting, welcoming the attendees. He then proceeded to present the items on the agenda of the Extraordinary Assembly. Accordingly, after reviewing the agenda, the following decisions were taken:

**First:** The majority of shareholders, owning 60% of the total attendance, approved the amendment of the texts of the following articles of the Company's Memorandum of Association and Articles of Association.

Shareholders owning 40% of the total attendance objected to all amended articles in accordance with Article (52) of the Companies Law. Approval was given to amend the text of Article No. (2) of the Articles of Association and (3) of the Memorandum of Association to read as follows:

**Article Text Before Amendment:**
The company's principal place of business and legal domicile are in the State of Kuwait. The Board of Directors may establish branches, agencies, offices, operations centers, or appoint representatives for it in Kuwait or abroad.

**Article Text After Amendment:**
The company's principal place of business and legal domicile are in the State of Kuwait, which is the domicile recognized for directing correspondence and judicial notices. A change in this domicile shall not be recognized unless the change is registered in the Commercial Register. The Board of Directors may establish branches, agencies, offices, operations centers, or appoint representatives for it in Kuwait or abroad.

**Voting Result:**
*   Approved: 60%
*   Disapproved: 40%

Approval to amend the text of Article No. (4) of the Articles of Association and (5) of the Memorandum of Association to read as follows:

**Article Text Before Amendment:**
The purposes for which the company was established are:
1- Carrying out all maintenance operations for oil or gas wells, or oil or gas related facilities, or industries arising from, branching from, or associated with them, onshore or offshore (after obtaining the approval of the Ministry of Energy <orig>وزارة الطاقة</orig>).
2- The company may undertake all legal actions, especially concluding commercial and technical agreements with other companies and entering into all associations that

# Top Car E-Commerce Company <orig>شركة توب كار للتجارة الإلكترونية</orig>
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
### For the Year Ended December 31, 2024

The Extraordinary General Assembly of Top Car E-Commerce Company <orig>شركة توب كار للتجارة الإلكترونية</orig> held its meeting on Monday, March 24, 2025, at 11:30 AM, online via the Zoom application. The meeting was chaired by the Chairman of the Board of Directors, Mr. Khalid Essam Al-Otaibi <orig>خالد عصام العتيبي</orig>, with the attendance of:
*   Mr. Yousef Akram Mustafa <orig>يوسف أكرم مصطفى</orig>, Board Member
*   Mr. Fahad Abdul Wahab Al-Khaled <orig>فهد عبد الوهاب الخالد</orig>, Chief Executive Officer
*   Shareholders with an attendance rate of 84.5%
*   Mr. Omar Osama Al-Zawawi <orig>عمر أسامة الزواوي</orig>/ representing Gulf Securities Depository Company <orig>الشركة الخليجية لحفظ الأوراق المالية</orig> (Custodian)
*   Mr. Bader Abdul Jader <orig>بدر عبد الجادر</orig> representing/ Independent Auditor Mr. Waleed Abdul Hameed Al-Sarraf <orig>وليد عبد الحميد الصراف</orig> from Ernst & Young Al-Aiban & Al-Osaimi & Partners <orig>إيرنست ويونغ العيبان والعصيمي وشركائهم</orig>

The Chairman of the Board of Directors opened the meeting, thanking the attendees for accepting the invitation extended to them. He then proceeded to review and discuss the items on the agenda to deliberate on them and make the necessary decisions.

**Item One:** Reviewing the company's future status.

Unanimous approval was given for the company's continuity by reducing the authorized, issued, and paid-up capital from KWD 1,000,000 to KWD 250,000, a reduction of KWD 750,000, to offset part of the losses amounting to KWD 828,308 as of December 31, 2024,

Accordingly, approval was given to amend Article 9 in the Memorandum of Association and Article 5 in the Articles of Association as follows:

**Text Before Amendment:**
The company's authorized capital was set at KWD 1,000,000 (One Million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>مليون دينار كويتي</orig>).
Distributed over (10,000,000) shares, with a value of (100 fils) per share, and all shares are cash shares.

**Text After Amendment:**
The company's authorized capital was set at KWD 250,000 (Two Hundred and Fifty Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>مائتان وخمسون ألف دينار كويتي</orig>).
Distributed over (2,500,000) shares, with a value of (100 fils) per share, and all shares are cash shares.

This is subject to the approval of the regulatory authorities.

The Chairman of the Board of Directors thanked the attendees and concluded the meeting, as previously mentioned, at 12:00 PM.

Approval of the Esteemed Board Members.

Chairman of the Board of Directors

Approval of the amendment to the text of Article No. (10) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> to become as follows:
Article Text Before Amendment
Every share entitles its owner to an equal share of five others without discrimination in the ownership of the company's assets and in the distributed profits as specified hereinafter.
Article Text After Amendment
1 - Founders and shareholders are considered members of the company, enjoying equal rights and subject to the same obligations, in accordance with the provisions of the law.
2 - A member of the company shall specifically enjoy the following rights:
1 - Receiving profits and obtaining bonus shares decided for distribution.
2 - Participating in the management of the company through membership in the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and attending general assemblies and participating in their deliberations, in accordance with the provisions of the law and the company's articles of association. Any provision in the company's articles of association to the contrary shall be null and void.
3 - Obtaining, at least seven days before the ordinary general assembly meeting, the company's financial statements for the expired accounting period, the Board of Directors' report, and the auditor's report.
4 - Disposing of shares owned by him and priority in subscribing to new shares, bonds, and sukuk in accordance with the provisions of the law and the company's articles of association.
5 - Obtaining a share of the company's assets upon liquidation after settling its debts.
3 - A member of the company shall specifically be obligated to:
1 - Paying the installments due on the shares he owns upon their due dates and paying compensation for delay in payment.
2 - Paying the expenses incurred by the company to collect unpaid installments of the value of his shares, and the company may execute on the shares to satisfy its rights.
3 - Implementing the resolutions issued by the company's General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>.
4 - Refraining from any act that would harm the financial or moral interests of the company
and committing to compensate for damages arising from violating this.
5 - Following the established rules and procedures regarding share trading.
4 - The shareholder's right to dispose of his shares is subject to the following two restrictions:
1 - A right of priority for shareholders in the company to purchase shares that their owner wishes to sell.
2 - Approval of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> for the share buyer.
Transactions referred to in Article (172) of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> are excluded from these two restrictions.
Voting Result:
Approved: 60%
Disapproved: 40%
Approval of the amendment to the text of Article No. (11) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> to become as follows:
Article Text Before Amendment
Since the shares are nominal, the last owner whose name is registered in the company's register shall be the sole rightful owner to receive the amounts due on the share, whether they are profits or a share in the ownership of the company's assets.
Article Text After Amendment
1 - The company shall have a special register kept with a clearing agency <orig>وكالة مقاصة</orig>, in which the names of shareholders, their nationalities, domiciles, the number and type of shares owned by each of them, and the paid value for each share shall be recorded.
2 - Any changes occurring to the data recorded in the shareholders' register shall be endorsed in accordance with the information received by the company or the clearing agency <orig>وكالة المقاصة</orig>. Any interested party may request the company or the clearing agency <orig>وكالة المقاصة</orig> to provide him with data from this register.
Voting Result:
Approved: 60%
Disapproved: 40%
Approval of the amendment to the text of Article No. (12) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> to become as follows:
Article Text Before Amendment
Capital may not be increased unless the share installments have been fully paid. New shares may not be issued for less than their nominal value. If issued at a higher value, the increase shall first be allocated to cover issuance expenses, then to the reserve or for share amortization.
Every shareholder shall have priority in subscribing to a portion of the new shares proportionate to the number of his shares. A period of fifteen days from the date of publishing the invitation to shareholders for this purpose shall be granted for exercising the right of priority. Shareholders may waive their right of priority in advance or restrict this right by any limitation, and the waiver may be for the purpose of establishing an employee stock option plan.
Article Text After Amendment
The authorized capital of the company may be increased – by a resolution issued by the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> – based on a reasoned proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> in this regard, provided that the resolution issued for the capital increase specifies the amount and methods of the increase.
The authorized capital may not be increased unless the value of the original shares has been fully paid. The Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> may authorize the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> to determine the date of its implementation.
The capital increase shall be covered by shares whose value is paid by one of the following methods:
1 - Offering the increased shares for public subscription.
2 - Converting funds from the optional reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الاختياري</orig> or from retained earnings <orig>الأرباح المحتجزة</orig> or from what exceeds the minimum legal reserve <orig>الاحتياطي القانوني</orig> into shares.
3 - Converting a debt on the company or bonds or sukuk into shares.

### Voting Result:
Approved: 60% Disapproved: 40%
Approval of the amendment to the text of Article No. (31) of the Articles of Association to become as follows:
### Text of the Article Before Amendment
Each shareholder shall have a number of votes equal to the number of his shares. Representation by proxy is permitted for attending the meeting, and minors and interdicted persons shall be represented by their legal guardians. No member may participate in voting on his own behalf, or on behalf of whom he legally represents, in matters related to a special interest for him or a conflict existing between him and the company.
### Text of the Article After Amendment
Each shareholder, regardless of the number of their shares, has the right to attend the General Assembly, and shall have a number of votes equal to the number of votes allocated to the same class of shares. A shareholder may not vote on their own behalf or on behalf of those they represent in matters related to a special interest for them, or a conflict existing between them and the company. Any condition or decision that violates this shall be null and void. A shareholder may appoint another person to attend on their behalf. The regulatory authority shall issue the required disclosures for proxies related to the attendance of a representative on behalf of the shareholder at the General Assembly.
### Voting Result:
Approved: 60% Disapproved: 40%
Approval of the amendment to the text of Article No. (32) of the Articles of Association to become as follows:
### Text of the Article Before Amendment
Shareholders shall register their names in a special register prepared for this purpose at the company's headquarters at least twenty-four hours before the scheduled time for the General Assembly meeting. The register shall include the shareholder's name, the number of shares they own, the number of shares they represent, and the names of their owners, along with the submission of the power of attorney. The shareholder shall be given an attendance card for the meeting stating the number of votes they are entitled to in person and by proxy, and every shareholder has the right to attend the Assembly.
### Text of the Article After Amendment
Every shareholder registered in the company's shareholder register with the clearing agency <orig>وكالة المقاصة</orig> has the right to attend General Assembly meetings. A shareholder may appoint another person to attend on their behalf by virtue of a special power of attorney or an authorization prepared by the company for this purpose. Anyone claiming a right over shares that conflicts with what is established in the company's shareholder register may apply to the judge of urgent matters <orig>قاضي الأمور الوقتية</orig> to issue an order on petition to deprive the disputed shareholder of voting for a period determined by the judge or until the dispute is settled by the competent court, in accordance with the procedures stipulated in the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات المدنية والتجارية</orig>.
### Voting Result:
Approved: 60% Disapproved: 40%
Approval of the amendment to the text of Article No. (33) of the Articles of Association to become as follows:
### Text of the Article Before Amendment
The provisions of the Commercial Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات التجارية</orig> shall apply to the quorum required for the valid convening of the General Assembly in its various capacities and to the majority required for adopting resolutions.
### Text of the Article After Amendment
The provisions of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig> shall apply to the quorum required for the valid convening of the General Assembly in its various capacities and to the majority required for adopting resolutions.
not less than one-tenth of the capital. The invitation to attend the meeting shall be sent, including a clear summary of the agenda and the following attachments:
- Registered letters sent to all shareholders at least one week before the scheduled meeting date.
- An announcement in at least two daily newspapers published in Arabic, and the announcement must be made twice, provided that the second announcement is made after a period of not less than one week from the date of the first announcement's publication and at least one week before the General Assembly meeting, with the second announcement published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in addition to the two daily newspapers.
The invitation must include the agenda. The founders shall set the agenda for the General Assembly convened as a founding assembly, and the Board of Directors shall set the agenda for the General Assembly convened as an ordinary and extraordinary assembly.
### Text of the Article After Amendment
The Annual Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية السنوية</orig> shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors within three months following the end of the financial year, at the time and place specified by the company's articles of association. The Board may invite the General Assembly whenever necessary. The Board of Directors must issue an invitation for the Assembly upon a reasoned request from a number of shareholders representing not less than 10% of the company's capital, or upon a request from the auditor. The inviting party shall prepare the agenda for the meeting.
The Chairman of the Assembly, the Secretary of the Board of Directors, and one of the attending minority shareholders shall record the resolutions of the General Assembly and any shareholder observations, ratify them, and submit a report on these resolutions and observations to the Ministry.
The provisions related to the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> shall apply to the procedures for inviting the Assembly, and the quorum for attendance and voting.
The Ministry must invite the General Assembly to a meeting within fifteen days if the invitation for the Assembly meeting is not issued by the Board of Directors for any reason in cases where the Board is required to invite the Assembly to a meeting.
The Ministry shall replace the Board of Directors in taking the necessary procedures for holding the meeting, and may preside over the meeting, unless the Assembly elects one of the shareholders for this purpose.
### Voting Result:
Approved: 60% Disapproved: 40%
Approval of the amendment to the text of Article No. (30) of the Articles of Association to become as follows:
### Text of the Article Before Amendment
In cases where the Assembly may be convened at the request of shareholders, auditors, or the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>, the agenda shall be prepared by the party requesting the convening of the Assembly, and no matter not included in the agenda may be discussed.
### Text of the Article After Amendment
In cases where the Assembly may be convened at the request of shareholders, auditors, or the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>, the agenda shall be prepared by the party requesting the convening of the Assembly. The General Assembly may not discuss matters not included in the agenda unless they are urgent matters that arose after the agenda was prepared or became apparent during the meeting, or if requested by a regulatory authority, the auditor, or a number of shareholders owning five percent of the company's capital. If, during the discussion, it becomes apparent that the information related to some presented matters is insufficient, the meeting must be postponed for a period not exceeding ten working days if requested by a number of shareholders.

Article Text After Amendment
a. The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, convened in ordinary session, shall be competent in all matters related to the company's affairs, except for what the law or these Articles of Association <orig>النظام</orig> have reserved for the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> convened in extraordinary session or in its capacity as a founding assembly.
b. The meeting of the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> shall be chaired by the Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> or his deputy, or by whomever the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> delegates for that purpose, or by whomever the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> elects from among the shareholders or others.
c. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must implement the resolutions of the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> unless those resolutions violate the law, the memorandum of association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig>, or these Articles of Association <orig>النظام</orig>. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must re-present the violating resolutions to the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> in a meeting called for the purpose of discussing the aspects of the violation.

Voting Result:
Approved: 60%
Disapproved: 40%
Approval of the amendment to the text of Article No. (38) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> to become as follows:
Article Text Before Amendment
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall submit to the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, convened in ordinary session, a report containing a statement on the company's operations and its financial and economic status, the company's budget, a statement of the profit and loss account, a statement on the remuneration of the members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and the auditors' fees, and a proposal for profit distribution in accordance with the provisions of the Commercial Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات التجارية</orig>.
Article Text After Amendment
Subject to the provisions of the law, the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> shall, in its annual meeting, adopt resolutions on matters falling within its jurisdiction, and in particular the following:
1. The Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> report on the company's activity and financial position for the ended fiscal year.
2. The auditor's report on the company's financial statements.
3. A report on any violations observed by regulatory authorities <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig> and for which penalties were imposed on the company.
4. The company's financial statements.
5. The Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> proposals regarding profit distribution.
6. Discharging the liability of the members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>.
7. Electing or dismissing members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, and determining their remuneration.
8. Appointing the company's auditor, and determining their fees or authorizing the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> to do so.
9. A report on transactions that have occurred or will occur with related parties, and related parties are defined according to International Accounting Principles <orig>مبادئ المحاسبة الدولية</orig>.

Voting Result:
Approved: 60%
Disapproved: 40%
Approval of the amendment to the text of Article No. (39) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> to become as follows:
Article Text Before Amendment
The Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, or upon a written request from shareholders representing fifteen percent of the company's issued capital or from the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig>. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must invite the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> to a meeting within thirty days from the date of the request.
If the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> fails to invite the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> within the period stipulated in the preceding paragraph, the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> shall issue the invitation for the meeting within fifteen days from the date of the expiry of the period referred to in the preceding paragraph.
Article Text After Amendment
a. The provisions related to the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> shall apply to the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig>, taking into account the provisions stipulated below.
