Approval of the amendment to the text of Article No. (44) of the Articles of Association to become as follows:
## Text of the Article Before Amendment
a. The auditor <orig>المراقب</orig> shall have the powers and obligations stipulated in the Commercial Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات التجارية</orig> and Law No. 5 of 1981 <orig>قانون مزاولة مهنة مراقبي الحسابات رقم 5 لسنة 1981</orig> regarding the practice of the auditing profession. In particular, they shall have the right to inspect all the company's books, records, and documents at any time, and to request any data they deem necessary to obtain. They shall also have the right to audit the company's assets and liabilities. If they are unable to exercise these powers, they shall state this in writing in a report submitted to the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and presented to the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, and they shall have the right to convene the General Assembly for this purpose.
## Text of the Article After Amendment
a. The auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig> shall, at all times, have the right to inspect all the company's books, records, and documents, and to request any data they deem necessary to obtain. They shall also have the right to audit the company's assets and liabilities. If they are prevented from exercising these rights, they shall state this in writing in a report submitted to the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and presented to the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, and the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> shall be notified thereof.
b. The auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig> shall be obligated to maintain the confidentiality of data and information obtained by virtue of their work, both during and after the termination of their work with the company. They shall not use this data and information to achieve personal gain or for the benefit of others, nor shall they disclose any company-related secrets. If the auditor violates this, they may be dismissed and required to pay compensation if necessary.
c. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> or a number of shareholders representing twenty-five percent of the issued capital may request the replacement of the auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig> during the financial year. Any decision taken regarding their replacement without following the procedures specified in the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig> shall be null and void.
d. In exceptional and urgent cases where the auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig> appointed by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> does not perform their duties for any reason, the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may appoint a replacement, provided that this matter is presented at the first meeting convened by the General Assembly for this purpose.
e. The auditor <orig>مدقق الحسابات</orig> may not be a chairman or a member of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> of the company whose accounts they audit, nor be entrusted with any administrative work therein, nor supervise its accounts, nor be a relative up to the second degree of anyone supervising the company's management or accounts. Furthermore, they may not purchase or sell shares of the companies whose accounts they audit during the auditing period, or perform any consulting work for the company.
Voting Result:
Approved: 60%
Disapproved: 40%
Approval of the amendment to the text of Article No. (41) of the Articles of Association to become as follows:
## Text of the Article Before Amendment
The following matters shall only be considered by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> convened in an extraordinary capacity:
1- Amending the Memorandum of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> or the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> of the company.
2- Selling the entire project undertaken by the company or disposing of it in any other way.
3- Dissolving, merging, converting, or splitting the company.
4- Increasing or decreasing the company's capital.
Any amendment to the company's regulations shall not be effective except after the approval of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
## Text of the Article After Amendment
Subject to other competencies stipulated by law, the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall be competent to address the following matters:
1- Amending the company's Articles of Association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>.
2- Selling the entire project for which the company was established or disposing of it in any other way.
3- Dissolving, merging, converting, or splitting the company.
4- Increasing or decreasing the company's capital.
Any resolution issued by the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall not be effective until the publication procedures <orig>إجراءات الإشهار</orig> have been completed.
The Ministry's <orig>الوزارة</orig> approval must be obtained if the resolution relates to the company's name, objectives, or capital, with the exception of increasing capital by issuing shares against profits achieved by the company or as a result of adding usable reserves to the capital.
Voting Result:
Approved: 60%
Disapproved: 40%
Approval of the amendment to the text of Article No. (45) of the Articles of Association to become as follows:
## Text of the Article Before Amendment
The auditor <orig>المراقب</orig> shall submit a report to the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> stating whether the balance sheet and profit and loss account are consistent with reality and honestly and clearly express the company's true financial position, whether the company maintains regular accounts, whether the inventory has been conducted in accordance with accepted principles, whether the data contained in the Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> report are consistent with what is recorded in the company's books, and whether there have been any violations of the company's regulations, legal provisions, or international accounting standards during the financial year that affect the company's activity or financial position, indicating whether these violations are still ongoing, within the limits of the information available to them. The auditor <orig>المراقب</orig> shall be responsible for the accuracy of the data contained in their report in their capacity as an agent.
Voting Result:
Approved: 60%
Disapproved: 40%
Approval of the amendment to the text of Article No. (42) of the Articles of Association to become as follows:
## Text of the Article Before Amendment
The company shall have one or more auditors <orig>مراقب حسابات</orig> from among certified public accountants <orig>المحاسبين القانونيين</orig>, appointed by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, which shall determine their fees. They shall audit the accounts of the financial year for which they were appointed.
## Text of the Article After Amendment
The company shall have one or more auditors <orig>مراقب حسابات</orig> from among certified public accountants <orig>المحاسبين القانونيين</orig>, appointed by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, which shall determine their fees or authorize the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> to determine them. They shall audit the accounts of the year on behalf of all shareholders, and every shareholder, during the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meeting, shall have the right to discuss the auditor <orig>المراقب</orig> and seek clarification on what is stated in their report.

## Text of the Article After Amendment
a. The auditor or his representative from the accountants who participated with him in the audit work shall attend the meetings of the Ordinary General Assembly and submit a report on the company's financial statements, and whether these statements show the company's financial position at the end of the financial year and the results of the company's operations for that year, and a statement of whether the data contained in the Board of Directors' report are consistent with what is contained in the company's books and documents, in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles and what is stipulated by the Law.
If the company has more than one auditor, they shall prepare a unified report. In case of disagreement among them on certain matters, this must be stated in the report, along with each of their viewpoints.
The report must specifically include the following data:
1. Whether the auditor has obtained the information he deems necessary for performing his duties.
2. Whether the balance sheet and profit and loss accounts are consistent with reality, include all that is stipulated by the Law and the company's articles of association, and honestly and clearly express the company's true financial position.
3. Whether the company maintains regular accounts.
4. Whether the inventory was conducted in accordance with established principles.
5. Whether the data contained in the Board of Directors' report are consistent with what is contained in the company's books.
6. Whether there have been violations of the provisions of the Law or the company's articles of association during the financial year, with a statement of whether these violations are still ongoing, within the limits of the information available to him.
7. Any other data specified by the Executive Regulations.
b. The auditor shall be responsible for the financial data contained in his report and for any damage incurred by the company, shareholders, or third parties due to errors committed by him during and because of his work. If the company has more than one auditor, they shall be jointly and severally liable unless one of them proves his non-participation in the error leading to liability. The auditor shall also be responsible for damages incurred by the company as a result of his resignation at an inappropriate time. Any shareholder may, during the Ordinary General Assembly meeting, discuss with the auditor and seek clarification from him regarding what is stated in his report.

**Voting Result:**
Approved: 60% Disapproved: 40%

**Approval of the amendment to the text of Article No. (47) of the Articles of Association to become as follows:**

### Text of the Article Before Amendment
Net profits shall be distributed as follows:
First - (10) ten percent shall be deducted and allocated to the statutory reserve account, unless the Articles of Association specify a higher percentage. The General Assembly may cease the deduction if the reserve exceeds half of the company's capital.
Second - (1) percent shall be deducted and allocated to the Kuwait Foundation for the Advancement of Sciences <orig>مؤسسة الكويت للتقدم العلمي</orig> account.
Third - A percentage shall be deducted and allocated to the optional reserve account, proposed by the Board of Directors and approved by the General Assembly. This deduction shall cease by a resolution of the Ordinary General Assembly based on a proposal from the Board of Directors.
Fourth - A portion of the profits shall be deducted based on a proposal from the Board of Directors and decided by the General Assembly to meet the company's obligations under labor laws. These funds may not be distributed to shareholders.
Fifth - The necessary amount shall be deducted to distribute a first share of profits amounting to (5) five percent to shareholders, as determined by the Board of Directors and decided by the General Assembly.
Sixth - After the foregoing, an amount decided by the Ordinary General Assembly shall be deducted, not exceeding (10) ten percent of the remainder, to be allocated for Board of Directors' remunerations.
Seventh - The remaining profits shall then be distributed to shareholders as an an additional share in profits, or carried forward to the next year based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, or allocated to establish a general reserve fund or an extraordinary depreciation fund.

### Text of the Article After Amendment
a. Annually, by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, a percentage of not less than ten percent of the net profits shall be deducted to form a statutory reserve for the company. The General Assembly may cease this deduction if the statutory reserve exceeds half of the company's issued capital.
b. The Ordinary General Assembly must decide to deduct a percentage of the profits to meet the company's obligations under labor and social insurance laws. A special fund may be established to assist the company's workers and employees.
c. Annually, by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, a percentage not exceeding ten percent of the net profits may be deducted to form an optional reserve allocated for purposes determined by the General Assembly.
d. The General Assembly, based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, may distribute profits to shareholders at the end of the financial year. For this distribution to be valid, it must be from real profits, in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and must not affect the company's paid-up capital.
e. 1% shall be deducted and allocated to the Kuwait Foundation for the Advancement of Sciences <orig>مؤسسة الكويت للتقدم العلمي</orig> account from the company's net profits.

**Voting Result:**
Approved: 60% Disapproved: 40%

**Approval of the amendment to the text of Article No. (49) of the Articles of Association to become as follows:**

### Text of the Article Before Amendment
The reserve fund shall be used, based on a resolution of the Board of Directors, in what is most beneficial to the company's interests. The statutory reserve may not be distributed to shareholders, but it may be used to ensure a profit distribution to shareholders of up to (5) five percent in years when the company's profits do not allow for this limit. If the statutory reserve exceeds half of the company's capital, the General Assembly may decide to use the excess for purposes it deems beneficial to the company and its shareholders.

### Text of the Article After Amendment
The statutory reserve may only be used to cover company losses or to ensure a profit distribution to shareholders at a rate not exceeding five percent of the paid-up capital in years when the company's profits do not allow for this distribution, due to the absence of an optional reserve that permits this percentage of profits to be distributed. What was deducted from the statutory reserve must be returned to it when the profits of subsequent years allow, unless this reserve exceeds half of the issued capital.

**Voting Result:**
Approved: 60% Disapproved: 40%

Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
Held on Wednesday, 26/03/2025

The Extraordinary General Assembly of the shareholders of Kout Food Group K.S.C. <orig>مجموعة كوت الغذائية ش.م.ك.</orig> was held at the premises of "Kout Food Group Company <orig>شركة مجموعة كوت الغذائية</orig>, Al-Qibla Area <orig>منطقة القبلة</orig>, Al-Sour Street <orig>شارع السور</orig>, Sayyid Yaqoub Al-Humaidhi Building <orig>عمارة السيد يعقوب الحميدي</orig>, Third Floor, Meeting Room" at 01:30 PM on Wednesday, March 26, 2025. The meeting was chaired by Mr. Faisal Ali Al-Osaimi <orig>فيصل علي العصيمي</orig>, Chairman of the Meeting – Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors, and attended by Mr. Talal Yousef Al-Harbi <orig>طلال يوسف الحربي</orig>, from Deloitte & Touche (Al-Wazzan & Co.) <orig>ديلويت و توش (الوزان و شركاه)</orig>, the company's auditors. After reviewing the attendance percentage of shareholders, both in person and by proxy, Mr. Faisal Ali Al-Osaimi <orig>فيصل علي العصيمي</orig>, Chairman of the Meeting – Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors, announced the availability of the legal quorum for the valid convening of the Extraordinary General Assembly, as the number of shares present in person and by proxy reached 36.381%, totaling 64,496,907 shares of the company's shares. Mr. Faisal Ali Al-Osaimi <orig>فيصل علي العصيمي</orig>, Chairman of the Meeting – Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors, opened the meeting session by welcoming the attendees, then proceeded to discuss the agenda items. The Chairman of the Meeting read the Board of Directors' report, then presented the agenda items for voting, whereupon the following was approved by unanimous vote of the shareholders present and represented at the meeting:

1) Approval of the Board of Directors' proposal to reduce the company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital from KWD 6,691,869.500 (Six Million, Six Hundred Ninety-One Thousand, Eight Hundred Sixty-Nine Kuwaiti Dinars and Five Hundred Fils) to KWD 6,678,194.500 (Six Million, Six Hundred Seventy-Eight Thousand, One Hundred Ninety-Four Kuwaiti Dinars and Five Hundred Fils) by canceling KWD 13,675 (Thirteen Thousand, Six Hundred Seventy-Five Kuwaiti Dinars) through the cancellation of 136,750 treasury shares owned by the company in its capital, in accordance with the procedures followed by the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>, and to authorize the Chairwoman of the Board of Directors and the Chief Executive Officer to take all necessary actions, sign all requests and documents of any nature, and undertake all required procedures in this regard.

2) Approval of the Board of Directors' proposal to amend the text of Article (6) of the Articles of Incorporation and the text of Article (5) of the Articles of Association, as follows, and to authorize the Chairwoman of the Board of Directors and the Chief Executive Officer to take all necessary actions, sign all requests and documents of any nature, and undertake all required procedures in this regard.
**Text before amendment:**
The company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital is set at KWD 6,691,869.500 (Six Million, Six Hundred Ninety-One Thousand, Eight Hundred Sixty-Nine Kuwaiti Dinars and Five Hundred Fils), distributed over 66,918,695 shares (Sixty-Six Million, Nine Hundred Eighteen Thousand, Six Hundred Ninety-Five Shares) at a value of one hundred fils per share, and all shares are cash shares.
**Text after amendment:**
The company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital is set at KWD 6,678,194.500 (Six Million, Six Hundred Seventy-Eight Thousand, One Hundred Ninety-Four Kuwaiti Dinars and Five Hundred Fils), distributed over 66,781,945 shares (Sixty-Six Million, Seven Hundred Eighty-One Thousand, Nine Hundred Forty-Five Shares) at a value of one hundred fils per share, and all shares are cash shares.

Approval of the amendment to the text of Article (52) of the Articles of Association to read as follows:
**Text of Article before amendment**
The company shall be dissolved for one of the reasons stipulated in the Commercial Companies Law.
**Text of Article after amendment**
The company shall be dissolved for one of the reasons stipulated in Companies Law No. 1/2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig> and its Executive Regulations.
**Voting Result:**
Approved: 60%
Disapproved: 40%

Approval of the amendment to the text of Article (53) of the Articles of Association to read as follows:
**Text of Article before amendment**
The company's assets shall be liquidated upon its dissolution in accordance with the provisions contained in the Commercial Companies Law.
**Text of Article after amendment**
The company's assets shall be liquidated upon its dissolution in accordance with the provisions contained in Companies Law No. 1/2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig> and its Executive Regulations.
**Voting Result:**

Disapproved: 40%

Approval of the amendment to the text of Article (54) of the Articles of Association to read as follows:
**Text of Article before amendment**
The provisions of Commercial Companies Law No. (25) of 2012 <orig>قانون الشركات التجارية رقم (25) لسنة 2012</orig> and its amendments contained in Law (97) of 2013 <orig>القانون (97) لسنة 2013</orig> and its Executive Regulations shall apply to all matters not specifically provided for in the company's Articles of Incorporation or Articles of Association, except after the approval of the competent regulatory authorities.
**Text of Article after amendment**
The provisions of Commercial Companies Law No. (1) of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات التجارية رقم (1) لسنة 2016</orig> and its amendments and its Executive Regulations shall apply to all matters not specifically provided for in the company's Articles of Incorporation or Articles of Association.

Approval of the amendment to the text of Article (69) of the Articles of Association to read as follows:

The founders declare:
*   Firstly – that the provisions of the Articles of Incorporation and Articles of Association conform to the model stipulated in Article (69) of the Commercial Companies Law.
*   Secondly – that they have subscribed to all shares.
*   Thirdly – that they have appointed the necessary administrative bodies to manage the company, and the first administrative body of the company shall be selected at the first meeting of shareholders acting as a founding assembly.

*   Firstly – that the provisions of the Articles of Incorporation and Articles of Association conform to the Law.
*   Secondly – that they have subscribed to all shares.
*   Thirdly – that they have appointed the necessary administrative bodies to manage the company, and the first administrative body of the company shall be selected at the first meeting of shareholders acting as a founding assembly.
**Voting Result:**
Approved: 60%
Disapproved: 40%

The meeting concluded at 1:30 PM on the same date of convening.

Therefore, specialized companies and establishments in the required field that meet the following conditions should:

2- Possess an excellent and integrated technical team.
3- Submit their work history documented with a certificate of good performance and have valid contracts for the maintenance, repair, and operation of swimming pool equipment.

Refer to the General Department of Financial Affairs <orig>الإدارة العامة للشئون المالية</orig> – Tenders Department <orig>إدارة المناقصات</orig> (at the Industrial Exhibitions <orig>المعارض الصناعية</orig>) to obtain the documents for this tender for a fee of (–/150) K.D. (two thousand five hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only) must be submitted. Please note that the final insurance for the tender is (10%) of the total contract value, and applicants must bring a copy of the tender announcement from the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>), along with the following documents:
- Valid registration receipt from the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig>.

### Minutes of the Meeting of the Births and Deaths Committee <orig>لجنة المواليد والوفيات</orig> held on 23/3/2025, No. 69, formed by Ministerial Resolution No. 2021/1650

After reviewing the requests submitted for amending data in the births and deaths registers, the Committee, after reviewing Article 15 of Law No. 36/69 <orig>القانون رقم 36/69</orig> and formed by Ministerial Resolution No. 2021/1650, decided:
*   Dr. / Head of the General Medical Council <orig>المجلس الطبي العام</orig> - Chairman
*   Mr. / Director of the Central Births and Deaths Registry Department <orig>إدارة السجل المركزي للمواليد والوفيات</orig> - Member
*   Ms. / Head of the Research and Opinion Section <orig>قسم البحوث والرأي</orig> - Member
*   Mr. / Head of the Registration Section <orig>قسم القيد</orig> - Member
*   Mr. / Head of the Deaths Section <orig>قسم الوفيات</orig> - Member
*   Mr. / Head of the Records Section <orig>قسم السجلات</orig> - Member

Ms. Alia Al-Saffar <orig>علياء الصفار</orig> acted as the Committee's Secretary.
The Committee reviewed requests from No. ((128)) to No. ((142)) in the attached list concerning data amendments in births and deaths registers for dropped birth and death registration requests.
The Committee, after reviewing and ensuring the completeness of the documents and papers, decided to announce the amendments and requests in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) in two consecutive issues. If, after the legal period (fifteen days) from the date of the last announcement, no objection is submitted, the Committee will decide to issue the birth and death certificates.

# Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>
## Announcement
### Practice No. (1-2026/2025)
The Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> announces to companies and specialized institutions in this field its need for the determination and maintenance of licenses for the Ministry of Justice's <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> Senior Management Data Project, in accordance with the terms and specifications outlined in the practice documents, which can be obtained from the Tenders Department - located in the Ministries Complex Building, Block (14), Third Floor - Financial Affairs Department, during official working hours, starting from Sunday, 13/04/2025. A subscription fee of (75 K.D.) only, seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> (non-refundable), is required. Offers must be submitted to the Tenders Department at the Ministry, accompanied by an initial security deposit of (2%) of the total bid value, provided that this security remains valid throughout the bid validity period (90) days. The deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Monday, 21/04/2025.
Director of Financial Affairs Department

## Announcement
### Practice No. (2-2026/2025)
The Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> announces to companies and specialized institutions in this field its need for the supply, installation, and equipping of mobile security rooms for the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> buildings, in accordance with the terms and specifications outlined in the practice documents, which can be obtained from the Tenders Department - located in the Ministries Complex Building, Block (14), Third Floor - Financial Affairs Department, during official working hours, starting from Sunday, 13/04/2025. A subscription fee of (75 K.D.) only, seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> (non-refundable), is required. Offers must be submitted to the Tenders Department at the Ministry, accompanied by an initial security deposit of (2%) of the total bid value. Please note that the bid opening procedures will take place at 11:00 AM on Monday, 05/05/2025, at the Ministries Complex Building, Third Floor, at 11:00 AM on Monday, 05/05/2025. Furthermore, a preliminary meeting will be held at the Ministry's headquarters in the Financial Affairs Department, located in the Ministries Complex Building, Block (14), Third Floor, at 11:00 AM on Monday, 28/04/2025. Whether the bidder attends this meeting or not, they will be bound by all decisions or recommendations resulting from the meeting, if any.
Director of Financial Affairs Department

Please note that the sale procedures will take place at the Sales Center - Al-Ardiya Al-Hirafiya <orig>العارضية الحرفية</orig>.

Announcement of Real Estate Public Auction
The Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> announces the public auction of the property described below, on Thursday, 8/5/2025, in Hall 52 - Second Floor, Palace of Justice <orig>قصر العدل</orig>, at 9:00 AM, in execution of the court judgment issued in lawsuit No. 2023/102 Sales/3,
Filed by:
1- Masha'el Mubarak Saad Al-Qaba <orig>مشاعل مبارك سعد القبا</orig>
2- Shu'a Mubarak Saad Al-Qaba <orig>شعاع مبارك سعد القبا</orig>
Against:
1- Sa'da Mohammed Al-Mukhalaf <orig>سعده محمد المخلف</orig>.
2- Director of the Real Estate Registration Department <orig>إدارة التسجيل العقاري</orig>, in his capacity.
3- Undersecretary of the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>, in his capacity.
4- Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig>.
First: Property Description: According to the attached description certificate.
- Property Document No. 3851/1983, located in Al-Jahra <orig>الجهراء</orig> area - Block 3 - Plot No. 105 - from Plan No. T.M. / 325-2/11/3 - 3B - with an area of 750 m².
For Inspection:
On 17/10/2022, the committee moved to Al-Jahra <orig>الجهراء</orig> area, Block 3, Al-Qasr <orig>القصر</orig>, Street 3, Avenue 6, Plot 105, House 2, from Plan No. (T.M. / 325-2/11/3 - 3B), automated dispute property number 14266117, to inspect the disputed property on site, in the presence and guidance of the two plaintiffs personally, and with the assistance of Mr. Khair Al-Diraya / Saad Mubarak Al-Mutairi <orig>سعد مبارك المطيري</orig>, who was sought for assistance by the department at the time of inspection, as follows:
- The disputed property is a beige stone-clad house consisting of a ground floor and a first floor, located on two corner streets, with adjacent neighbors on the remaining sides. The property has two annexes on the two facades of the house, from the side street and from the front street. There is a large setback for the property from the front street, and there is an internal courtyard within the property.
- The disputed property conforms in terms of general and specific specifications to Document No. 3851, registered on 24/4/1983, with an area of 750 m², as stated in the deed of ownership by inheritance and reciprocal relinquishment issued by the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>, Real Estate Registration and Documentation Department <orig>إدارة التسجيل العقاري والتوثيق</orig>.
- The ground floor consists of 5 rooms, 3 bathrooms, a kitchen, a large hall, and another hall with a preparation counter.
- The annex located on the front street consists of 2 rooms, 2 bathrooms, and a kitchen, and is rented to others. The two plaintiffs explained its components to the expert.
- The first floor consists of two apartments rented to others. The apartment located on the side street consists of a hall, two rooms, a bathroom, and a kitchen. The apartment located on the front street consists of 3 rooms, 2 bathrooms, and a kitchen. The two plaintiffs explained the components of both apartments to the expert.
- The air conditioning in the disputed property is central on the ground floor, and split units and window air conditioners on the first floor and in the annexes.
- The expert asked the two plaintiffs about the layout of the property subject of the lawsuit, and they clarified that it is in the possession of the first defendant, who lives there with her son, and that her son and his family have been paying them rent in recent years, and there are also tenants in the property as stated.
Second: Auction Terms:
First: The auction shall commence with a base price of KWD 526,500 (Five Hundred Twenty-Six Thousand Five Hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of the price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Execution Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees immediately upon the conclusion of the sale session.
Third: If the bidder whose offer was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding will be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the initial bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding will immediately be reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no offer not accompanied by the deposit of its full value will be considered. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and property registration fees, execution procedure expenses amounting to KWD 200, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication expenses for the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in accordance with the law and at the request of those directly involved in the sale procedures, and at their responsibility, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.

Announcement of Real Estate Sale by Public Auction

The Registry Department <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> announces the public auction of the two properties described below, on Thursday, 8/5/2025 – Hall 52 – on the second floor of the Palace of Justice <orig>قصر العدل</orig> at 9:00 AM – in execution of the court judgment issued in lawsuit No. 2024/148 Sales/3 <orig>بيوع/3</orig>.

Filed by: Jameela Mohammed Saad Al-Baidan <orig>جميلة محمد سعد البيدان</orig>.
Against: The heirs of the late/ Munira Mohammed Saad Al-Baidan <orig>منيره محمد سعد البيدان</orig>, namely:
1- Munira Mohammed Saad Al-Baidan <orig>منيره محمد سعد البيدان</orig>.
2- Hajeera Mohammed Saad Al-Baidan <orig>هجيره محمد سعد البيدان</orig>.
3- Amani Mohammed Saad Al-Baidan <orig>أماني محمد سعد البيدان</orig>.
4- Nawaf Mohammed Saad Al-Baidan <orig>نواف محمد سعد البيدان</orig>.
5- Khalid Mohammed Saad Al-Baidan <orig>خالد محمد سعد البيدان</orig>.
6- Sara Mohammed Saad Al-Baidan <orig>ساره محمد سعد البيدان</orig>.
7- Khazna Hudaib Marzouq Al-Shafnaa <orig>خزنه هديب مرزوق الشفناء</orig>.
8- Saad Mohammed Saad Al-Baidan <orig>سعد محمد سعد البيدان</orig>.

## First: Property Descriptions: According to the attached description certificates.

**Property One:**
*   Property Document No. 2003/546 located in Farwaniya <orig>الفروانية</orig> – Plot No. (31), Block No. (1) of Plan No. 27305, with an area of 710 m2, at a base price of K.D. 1,400,000 (One Million Four Hundred Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
*   Note: There is a violation of balcony enclosure on all floors.
*   The building consists of 4 floors, with 4 identical apartments on each floor. Each apartment consists of (a hall + a room + a bathroom + a kitchen), noting that apartment rents vary from K.D. 190-220 per month, according to the plaintiff's agent's statement.
*   The rooftop is vacant.
*   The expert <orig>خبير الدراسة</orig> recorded his observations in preparation for estimating the value of the property subject to the lawsuit.

### *Inspection (for Property One):*
The expert <orig>الخبرة</orig> on 3/1/2023 moved to Farwaniya <orig>الفروانية</orig> area, Block 2, Street 131, Building No. 31, Plot 7335 – Automated Number 90569902, to inspect one of the properties subject to the lawsuit, in the presence of the reading expert <orig>خبير القراية</orig>, the plaintiff's agent, the agents of the third, fifth, sixth, seventh, and eighth defendants, and the agents of the first, second, fourth, and eighth defendants, or their representatives, regarding attendance verification number, and the following was found:
*   The property is a building located at the intersection of (3 streets), including Al-Ghazali Street <orig>شارع الغزالي</orig>, and consists of a mezzanine and 4 identical floors.
    *   The ground floor (mezzanine) has two apartments, each containing (a room + a hall + a kitchen + a bathroom + a guard's room with a bathroom).
    *   The ground floor has a shop leased as a restaurant with a monthly rent of K.D. 1300, according to the plaintiff's agent's statement.

**Property Two:**
*   Property Document No. 2006/678 located in Farwaniya <orig>الفروانية</orig> – Plot No. (35), Block No. (73) of Plan No. 31585, with an area of 768 m2, at a base price of K.D. 1,650,000 (One Million Six Hundred Fifty Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
*   Note: There is a violation of increased shop area according to the Municipality's letter <orig>كتاب البلدية</orig>.
*   The expert <orig>الخبرة</orig> at the same session moved to the second property subject to the lawsuit in Farwaniya <orig>الفروانية</orig> area, Block 2, Street 81, Plot 31, Automated Number (82231358), with the same attendees as for the inspection of Property One, and the following was found:
*   The property is a building located on two streets (a wide alleyway <orig>سكة واسعة</orig>) and consists of a mezzanine and 6 identical floors.
*   The ground floor (mezzanine) contains 4 apartments, detailed as 2 apartments consisting of (a hall + a room + a bathroom + a kitchen).
*   And one apartment consisting of (a hall + 2 rooms + a bathroom + a kitchen) and a studio apartment (a room + a bathroom + a kitchen).
*   The ground floor has a shop leased as a salon with a monthly rent of K.D. 700, according to the plaintiff's agent's statement.
*   The building consists of 6 floors, each floor containing 4 identical apartments. Each apartment contains (a hall + 2 rooms + a bathroom + a kitchen), noting that apartment rents vary from K.D. 210-230 per month, according to the plaintiff's agent's statement.
*   The rooftop is vacant.

## Second: Auction Terms:

*   **First:** The auction shall commence at the base price specified for each property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of the price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
*   **Second:** The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees immediately upon the commencement of the sale session.
*   **Third:** If the bidder whose offer was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit one-fifth of the price at which the auction was awarded.
*   **Fourth:** If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be resumed in the same session based on the price at which the auction was awarded.
*   **Fifth:** If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one else comes forward to bid, the bidding shall immediately resume at their expense in that session with any offer not accompanied by the deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
*   **Sixth:** In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and property registration fees, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to K.D. 200, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
*   **Seventh:** This announcement shall be published according to the law, and bidders are requested to follow the sale procedures of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
*   **Eighth:** The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.

**Notice:**
1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> according to Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, according to Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the dispossessed owner is residing in the property to be sold as a tenant by force of law, the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

President of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> 31 December 2023, and then the fair market value of equity rights in the company
Mahmoud Haider and Sons General Trading and Contracting Co. W.L.L. <orig>محمود حيدر وأولاده للتجارة العامة والمقاولات ذ</orig>.

The total value of Mahmoud Haidar & Sons General Trading and Contracting Company LLC <orig>شركة محمود حيدر وأولاده للتجارة العامة والمقاولات ذ.م.م.</orig> as of December 31st is KWD 7,294,211 (seven million, two hundred ninety-four thousand, and eleven Kuwaiti Dinars).
The fair market value of the share of Mr. Maitham Mahmoud Haji Haidar Abdullah <orig>ميثم محمود حاجي حيدر عبد الله</orig> in Mahmoud Haidar & Sons General Trading and Contracting Company LLC <orig>شركة محمود حيدر وأولاده للتجارة العامة والمقاولات ذ.م.م.</orig> as of December 31, 2023, is KWD 72,942.11 (seventy-two thousand, nine hundred forty-two Kuwaiti Dinars and eleven fils). KWD 7,294,211 ÷ 100 = KWD 72,942.11, with the necessity of drawing attention to the following:
a) There is an outstanding debit balance due from Mr. Maitham Mahmoud Haji Haidar Abdullah <orig>ميثم محمود حاجي حيدر عبد الله</orig> amounting to KWD 1,341,000, which was received from the company's data and is included within the balance of related party debtors as of December 31, 2023.
b) According to the documents reviewed, submitted by the management of Mahmoud Haidar & Sons General Trading and Contracting Company LLC <orig>شركة محمود حيدر وأولاده للتجارة العامة والمقاولات ذ.م.م.</orig>, a document dated December 27, 2020, was reviewed, which is a limited liability company dissolution contract by virtue of an appellate court judgment. The legal opinion issued by the Minister of Justice <orig>وزير العدل</orig> on June 14, 2022, was adopted, by virtue of which the share of Mr. Maitham Mahmoud Haji Haidar Abdullah <orig>ميثم محمود حاجي حيدر عبد الله</orig> was amended to become 33 shares instead of one share. Accordingly, if this amendment is adopted, the total value of those 33 shares would be KWD 2,407,089.63 (two million, four hundred seven thousand, eighty-nine Kuwaiti Dinars and sixty-three fils). Consequently, the net amount allocated to Mr. Maitham Mahmoud Haji Haidar Abdullah <orig>ميثم محمود حاجي حيدر عبد الله</orig> becomes KWD 1,066,089.63 (one million, sixty-six thousand, eighty-nine Kuwaiti Dinars and sixty-three fils) after deducting the outstanding debit balance due from him as of December 31, 2023.
In accordance with the court's decision regarding the appointment of the expert dated November 23, 2023, which is for the valuation of only one share, we have valued the company and determined the value of one share for Mr. Maitham Mahmoud Haji Haidar Abdullah <orig>ميثم محمود حاجي حيدر عبد الله</orig>. The matter is left to the court panel to consider the documents and/or other issued judgments.
The comparable study should be read in light of the required costs related to preparing a study to determine the fair value of the shares owned by Mr. Maitham Mahmoud Haji Haidar Abdullah <orig>ميثم محمود حاجي حيدر عبد الله</orig> in Mahmoud Haidar & Sons General Trading and Contracting Company LLC <orig>شركة محمود حيدر وأولاده للتجارة العامة والمقاولات ذ.م.م.</orig> as of December 31, 2023. The comparable study was prepared based on the technical and financial information provided by the management of Mahmoud Haidar & Sons General Trading and Contracting Company LLC <orig>شركة محمود حيدر وأولاده للتجارة العامة والمقاولات ذ.م.م.</orig> as of the date of the comparable study, without any independent verification and/or thorough examination of the unknown aspects of that data/information. The study is considered confidential, and no one has the right to quote it in whole or in part, refer to it, or cite

### 1.6. Valuation Standard
The valuation standard used is Fair Market Value, which is defined as "the price at which property would change hands between a willing buyer and a willing seller, neither being under any compulsion to buy or to sell, and both having reasonable knowledge of relevant facts."
### 1.7. Professional Standards
The present valuation and report have been prepared in accordance with the professional standards of the National Association of Certified Valuation (Analysts) <orig>الجمعية الوطنية لخليجي التقييم المعتمدين</orig>, where appropriate procedures (in our professional opinion) were followed for the scope of work requirements, given the time available to complete the valuation report task.
### 1.8. Valuation Date
The valuation was conducted as of December 31, 2023.
### 1.9. Valuation Conclusion

1.1 Income Approach
- The Income Approach <orig>منهج الدخل</orig> is based on the economic principle of expectation. In this approach, the value of the investment subject to valuation is the present value of the economic revenues expected to be collected by the investment for valuation purposes. The measurement of economic revenues analyzed can be defined in several ways.
5.1.2 Market Approach
- The Market Approach <orig>منهج السوق</orig> is a method of determining an indicator of the value of a business, a business ownership interest, a security, or an intangible asset using one or more methods that compare the subject with similar businesses, ownership interests, securities, or intangible assets that have been generally sold. This can be accomplished by comparison with companies that offer their shares for public trading or by analyzing an actual transaction of similar sold businesses. It may also include analyzing previous transactions in the company's shares (if any).
5.3.1 Asset Approach
- The Asset Approach <orig>منهج الأصل</orig> is based on the value of net assets less liabilities, as commonly used. This approach begins with the book values of the balance sheet as close as possible to the valuation date, and after including assets and liabilities, including those not recorded, at fair value.
Different valuation methods can be used, including one or more of the three categories of valuation approaches in any valuation study. All applicable methods must be considered, provided that the most reliable method or methods are chosen for valuing the properties subject to valuation and that are appropriate for the valuation study.
5.2 Chosen Approach/Method
- The following valuation approach we adopted to determine the fair value of equity in the company is the Asset Approach <orig>منهج الأصل</orig> (Net Asset Value Method <orig>طريقة صافي قيمة الأصول</orig>), given that Mahmoud Haider and Sons General Trading and Contracting Company W.L.L. <orig>شركة محمود حيدر وأولاده للتجارة العامة والمقاولات ذ.م.م</orig> has no current operating elements and its value lies in its net current assets and investments.

5.1 Valuation Approaches / Methods
- There are three traditional valuation approaches: the Income Approach <orig>منهج الدخل</orig>, the Market Approach <orig>منهج السوق</orig>, and the Cost Approach <orig>منهج التكلفة</orig> or Asset Approach <orig>منهج الأصل</orig>. Accordingly, if this amendment is adopted, the total value of these 33 shares would be KWD 2,407,089.63 (Two million four hundred seven thousand eighty-nine Kuwaiti Dinars and sixty-three fils). Consequently, the net amount exposed to Mr. Maitham Mahmoud Haji Haidar Abdullah <orig>ميثم محمود حاجي حيدر عبد الله</orig> becomes KWD 1,066,089.63 (One million sixty-six thousand eighty-nine Kuwaiti Dinars and sixty-three fils) after deducting the outstanding debit balance due from him as of December 31, 2023.
(c) In accordance with the court's decision regarding the appointment of the expert dated November 23, 2023, which is to estimate the value of only one share, we have valued the company and determined the value of one share for Mr. Maitham Mahmoud Haji Haidar Abdullah <orig>ميثم محمود حاجي حيدر عبد الله</orig>. The matter is left to the court's discretion to consider other documents and judgments issued.
(d) Application of the valuation value for the specific purpose mentioned in the 'Purpose of Valuation' section of this report, representing the main scope of work performed by the expert - Licensed Auditor Class A No. 152 <orig>مراقب حسابات مرخص فئة أ رقم 152</orig> in estimating the fair value of the shares owned by Mr. Maitham Mahmoud Haji Haidar Abdullah <orig>ميثم محمود حاجي حيدر عبد الله</orig> in Mahmoud Haidar & Sons General Trading and Contracting Co. W.L.L. <orig>شركة محمود حيدر وأولاده للتجارة العامة والمقاولات ذ.م.م.</orig> as of December 31, 2023.
(e) The different value estimates presented in this report apply only to this report and cannot be used outside the context presented herein.
(f) The nature and extent of the information available to us may not be formal, coordinated, or comprehensive for all components being valued.
(g) The information, estimates, and opinions contained in this report, obtained from management sources, are considered reliable. However, we have not independently verified this information, and we assume no responsibility for the accuracy of the information obtained from or provided to us by these sources.
(h) The financial information of Mahmoud Haidar & Sons General Trading and Contracting Co. W.L.L. <orig>شركة محمود حيدر وأولاده للتجارة العامة والمقاولات ذ.م.م.</orig> has been included solely to arrive at the value conclusion presented in this report and should not be used for any other purpose. Due to the limited purpose of the information presented, the information may not be complete and may contain deviations from generally accepted accounting principles for International Financial Reporting Standards. We have not audited, reviewed, or compiled this information and express no assurance regarding it.
(i) The management of Mahmoud Haidar & Sons General Trading and Contracting Co. W.L.L. <orig>شركة محمود حيدر وأولاده للتجارة العامة والمقاولات ذ.م.م.</orig> has undertaken that the information they provided is complete and accurate in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles.

Explanations
1- Represents balances due from trade debtors, which have been reduced by 50% as a precautionary measure due to significant doubt regarding the company's ability to collect these balances, given the absence of current activity.
2- The value of real estate investments has been reduced by 30% due to the inability to ascertain the market value of these investments.
3- The value of financial investments available for sale has been reduced by 50% due to the inability to ascertain the market value of these investments.
6- Conclusion
Based on our analysis of the information presented in this report, the underlying assumptions, and the net asset value method, the net asset value as of December 31, 2023, was concluded. Consequently, the fair value of equity in Mahmoud Haidar & Sons General Trading and Contracting Co. W.L.L. <orig>شركة محمود حيدر وأولاده للتجارة العامة والمقاولات ذ.م.م.</orig> as of December 31, 2023, is KWD 8,581,424 (Eight million five hundred eighty-one thousand four hundred twenty-four Kuwaiti Dinars). Taking into account a 15% discount factor, the value becomes KWD 7,294,211 (Seven million two hundred ninety-four thousand two hundred eleven Kuwaiti Dinars).
- Consequently, the value of one share is estimated at KWD 72,942.11 (Seventy-two thousand nine hundred forty-two Kuwaiti Dinars and eleven fils) - KWD 7,294,211 ÷ 100 = KWD 72,942.11.
- After reviewing the case documents and the documents submitted by Mahmoud Haidar & Sons General Trading and Contracting Co. W.L.L. <orig>شركة محمود حيدر وأولاده للتجارة العامة والمقاولات ذ.م.م.</orig>, including the limited liability company amendment contract dated July 9, 2019, it became clear to us that Maitham Mahmoud Haji Haidar Abdullah's <orig>ميثم محمود حاجي حيدر عبد الله</orig> share in Mahmoud Haidar & Sons General Trading and Contracting Co. W.L.L. <orig>شركة محمود حيدر وأولاده للتجارة العامة والمقاولات ذ.م.م.</orig> represents one share, equivalent to 1% of the company's total shares.

Secondly: Auction Terms:
Firstly: The auction shall commence at the base price indicated in the descriptions. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Secondly: The full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
Thirdly: If the bidder whose offer was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction shall be re-held at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction shall be re-held in the same session based on this new price.
Fifthly: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the auction shall be immediately re-held at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No bid in this session shall be considered unless accompanied by the deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the sale price of the shares.

Ninthly: The company and any of the partners may - even before the auction award judgment is issued - settle the debt of the debtor partner to the seizing creditor.
Tenthly: The company may - even before the auction award judgment is issued - recover a portion of the seized shares to the extent sufficient to settle the creditor's debt.

Secondly: Auction Conditions:
Firstly: The auction shall commence with the base price indicated for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Department of Execution <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Secondly: Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Thirdly: If the bidder whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding shall be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a full deposit of the auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifthly: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the subsequent session, and no one comes forward to bid with the ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session, and no bid in this session shall be considered valid unless accompanied by a full deposit of its value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any decrease in the property's price.
Sixthly: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the fees for transfer and registration of ownership, execution procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventhly: This announcement is published in application of the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures do so at their own responsibility, without the Department of Clerks <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighthly: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates any ignorance.
Notice:
1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose property has been expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."
President of the General Court <orig>رئيس المحكمة الكلية</orig> whose ownership was expropriated residing in the property shall remain in it as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent.
President of the General Court <orig>رئيس المحكمة الكلية</orig>

Announcement of Sale of Two Properties by Public Auction
The Department of Clerks <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> announces the public auction of the two properties described below, on Wednesday, 2025/5/7, in Hall - 48 - on the second floor of the Palace of Justice <orig>قصر العدل</orig> at 9:00 AM - this is in execution of the court judgment issued in lawsuit No. 368/2021 Sales/2 <orig>بيوع/2</orig>.

First: The auction shall start at the basic price associated with the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Third: If the bidder whose offer was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction award judgment will be issued in their favor, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full price. In this case, the bidding will be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward to bid for the price, the bidding will immediately be reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no offer not accompanied by the deposit of its full value will be considered.
The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property price and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures are responsible for them, without the Registry Department <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.

*Inspection:
The disputed property located in Al-Andalus <orig>الأندلس</orig> area – Plot 10 – Street 2 – House 231 – bearing automated number 15009737, was inspected as follows:
-The house consists of a ground floor and a first floor, and a large structure (Kirby) was built on the roof.
-There are 3 entrances to the house: an entrance to the Diwaniya <orig>الديوانية</orig>, an entrance to the ground floor, and a side entrance leading to the stairs and the first floor.
-It was found that the property was previously divided by a prepared division, whereby the plaintiff utilizes the ground floor, and the defendant utilizes the first floor and the Diwaniya <orig>الديوانية</orig>.
-It was revealed that the entire ground floor is rented by the plaintiff, as the tenant of this entire floor and Diwaniya <orig>الديوانية</orig> admitted to paying a monthly rent of 850 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, but she refused to have her name recorded in the minutes.
-The ground floor consists of a hall + two apartments + a reception hall + washbasins + a bathroom + a kitchen + a maid's room + a laundry room + a courtyard.
-The hall floors are ceramic, the ceilings are gypsum board, and the maid's room and laundry room floors are tile.
-The first floor consists of: a hall + a kitchen + a storage room + 3 apartments.
-The first apartment on the first floor consists of: a corridor with a small preparatory kitchen + two rooms + a bathroom (occupied by the family of the parties' son).
-The second apartment on the first floor consists of: two rooms + two bathrooms. (Occupied by the family of the parties' daughter).
-The rooms in both apartments have parquet flooring, hidden gypsum board ceilings, and the corridor floors are marble-colored ceramic, with plain painted walls.
-The hall floors are ceramic, and the wall has hidden gypsum board decor with hidden lighting.
-The third apartment on the first floor consists of: a bedroom + a bathroom + an external washbasin. Its floors are ceramic, and the ceiling is plain gypsum board. (Occupied by the defendant and his wife).
-The kitchen: its floors are ceramic, and the walls are decorated with stones and ceramic.
-The external stairs are made of tile.
-The roof has a hall made of Kirby <orig>كيربي</orig> and a preparatory kitchen with a glass facade wall and a glass door leading to an indoor garden where the floors are tiled with artificial grass and outdoor seating (chairs and tables) has been placed, utilized by the plaintiff.
-There is also a Kirby <orig>كيربي</orig> room on the roof for the defendant's son, containing a bedroom and a bathroom. Its floors are tile, and the bathroom is plain ceramic.
-The Diwaniya <orig>الديوانية</orig>: a hall + a small washbasin + a small bathroom. Its floors are ceramic, the walls are plain painted, and the bathroom has old commercial porcelain. It has been utilized as a storage room.
-The defendant acknowledged that the house is divisible and that the plaintiff has been benefiting from the ground floor for four years for 850 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig> monthly, and he rents the apartments on the first floor to his children. The inspection revealed that the first apartment is occupied by the defendant's son and his wife, and the second apartment by the defendant's daughter and her husband.

## Second: Auction Terms and Conditions:

First: The auction shall commence at the property's base price. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of the price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.

Second: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit, upon the conclusion of the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.

Third: If the bidder whose offer was approved fails to deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price, and the bidding on their account shall be canceled in the same session based on the price at which the sale was awarded.

Fourth: In the event that the bidder whose offer was approved deposits at least one-fifth of the price, the sale shall be postponed with a ten percent increase.

Fifth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session who accepts to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be re-conducted in the same session based on this price.

Sixth: If the initial bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall immediately be re-conducted on their account based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no offer not accompanied by a full deposit of its value shall be considered. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.

Seventh: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and property registration fees, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.

Eighth: This announcement is published in application of the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures are requested to proceed at their own responsibility, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.

Ninth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates any ignorance.

Notice:
1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> stipulates that "If the dispossessed owner is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at the market rent <orig>أجرة المثل</orig>."

** And according to the Expert's Report
The property subject of the dispute, as it exists, located in Al-Salam <orig>السلام</orig> area, Block No. (2) - Street No. (214), House No. (30). The inspection was carried out as follows:
-1 The property subject of the dispute conforms to the general and specific specifications of Document No. (4231) dated 12/4/1998 and an area of 500 m² - Automated No. 15620421.
-2 The property subject of the dispute is a private residence house overlooking one street and bordered by a neighbor on three sides. We knocked on the door, but there was no response, and the plaintiff's agent was unable to enable the expert to inspect the interior of the property. Therefore, we decided to take the specifications and inspect the property from the outside.
-3 The property subject of the dispute consists of a basement, ground floor, first floor, and second floor, and the property's condition is good.
-4 The exterior cladding is white stone.
-5 The expert could not ascertain the possessor or beneficiary of the property or its use.
-6 The study expert inspected the property from the outside in preparation for estimating its value as land and buildings and a quarter, and the special report for that was submitted.
Secondly: Auction Terms:
Firstly: The auction shall commence at the basic price indicated in the expert's report. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Secondly: Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Thirdly: If the bidder whose bid was approved fails to deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding shall be re-opened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full price. In this case, the bidding shall be re-opened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifthly: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall immediately be re-opened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No bid in this session shall be considered valid unless accompanied by the deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixthly: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the ownership fees, procedural and enforcement expenses, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventhly: This announcement shall be published in application of the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures shall do so at their own responsibility, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighthly: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.
Notice: 1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the dispossessed owner is residing in the property, they shall be considered a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent <orig>أجرة المثل</orig>."
President of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig>

The founders acknowledge that they have deposited the cash capital of the company at a rate of (100%) of the company's cash capital from the total value of the shares they subscribed to, amounting to (2,400,000), each according to their subscription percentage, with Warba Bank <orig>بنك وربة</orig> pursuant to the certificate issued by the said bank and dated (06/08/2024), attached to the original of this contract.

Article (10)
Expenses, wages, disbursements, and costs that the company is committed to paying due to its establishment, in accordance with the statement attached to the original contract, shall be deducted from the general expenses account.

Article (11)
The founders who signed this contract undertake to carry out all necessary procedures to complete the establishment of the company and commit to excluding and canceling fictitious and duplicate subscription requests and taking the necessary measures to achieve this. For this purpose, they have authorized Mr. Nasser Musaed Bader Al-Sayer <orig>ناصر مساعد بدر الساير</orig> to take legal actions, complete the necessary documents, and introduce any amendments that official authorities deem necessary to be included in the contract or its attached Articles of Association.
Within three months from the date of completion of the subscription and before the constituent assembly meeting, the founders must submit to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> a statement detailing the number of shares subscribed to by each founder, their payment of the due installments, and their completion of

*   402 of 2019 dated 04/02/2019
*   2607 of 2022 dated 06/10/2022
*   274 of 2024 dated 22/01/2024

The ownership of a limited liability company named and addressed as Imtiyazat Al-Sayer Holding Company <orig>شركة امتيازات الساير القابضة</orig>, with a capital of K.D. 2,400,000 (Two Million Four Hundred Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars), has been confined between the parties to this contract, pursuant to the amendment contract documented under No. 274 of 2024.
The founders acknowledge their legal capacity to establish a Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company (Imtiyazat Al-Sayer Holding Company <orig>شركة امتيازات الساير القابضة</orig>) among themselves and their commitment to the rules stipulated for its establishment in accordance with the provisions of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig> and its amendments and executive regulations. They also acknowledge their commitment to all rules stipulated for the establishment of the company in accordance with the provisions of the following articles: –

Article (1)
The preceding preamble is considered an integral part of this contract.

Article (2)
The founders acknowledge that the company was established in accordance with the provisions of Companies Law No. (1) of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم ( 1 ) لسنة 2016</orig> and its amendments, its executive regulations, and the provisions of this contract.
The company shall acquire legal personality from the date of registration.
It shall not be permitted to commence its activities except from the date of registration and the approval of all regulatory bodies for its engagement in the activity.

Article (3)
Company Name / Imtiyazat Al-Sayer Holding Company <orig>شركة امتيازات الساير القابضة</orig> and its commercial address is a Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company.

Article (4)
The company's main center is located in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and its domicile is in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>. The partners may transfer the main center to any other location within Kuwait, and open branches and agencies for the company inside and outside the State of Kuwait. The company shall have the right to conduct the aforementioned activities in the State of Kuwait and abroad, either as a principal or as an agent. The company may also engage in similar, complementary, necessary, or related activities to its stated purposes.
The company's headquarters shall be considered its legal domicile for directing correspondence and judicial notices to it, and its data shall be recorded in the Commercial Register. Any change to this headquarters shall not be recognized until it is registered in the Commercial Register.

Article (5)
The company's duration is unlimited, commencing from the date of registration.

Article (6)
Without prejudice to the provisions of Decree-Law No. 1/2016 <orig>المرسوم بقانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig> concerning Companies and its amendments – and its executive regulations, the purposes for which the company was established are:
1 – Investing its funds in trading shares, bonds, and other securities.
2 – Owning real estate and movable assets necessary for conducting its business within the limits permitted by law.
3 – Financing or lending to companies in which it owns shares or stakes, and guaranteeing them to third parties. In this case, the holding company's participation percentage in the capital of the borrowing company must not be less than 20 percent.
4 – Owning intellectual property rights such as patents, trademarks, industrial designs, franchise rights, and other intangible rights, and exploiting them.
