### Article (12)
The founders of the company shall be jointly and severally liable among themselves for compensating any damage incurred by the company, its shareholders, or third parties due to the invalidity of the company's contract.
### Article (1)
Al-Sayer Privileges Holding Company <orig>امتيازات الساير القابضة</orig>
Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company (K.C.S.C.) <orig>ش.م.ك.م.</orig> Closed Company
Articles of Association
Establishment of the Company
A – Elements of Company Establishment
### Article (1)
The company was established in accordance with the provisions of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig> and its amendments and executive regulations, and these Articles of Association, between the shareholders whose provisions are set forth hereinafter, as a Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company (K.C.S.C.) <orig>ش.م.ك.م.</orig>.
### Article (2)
The company's head office and legal domicile are in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, which is the address to be relied upon for directing correspondence and judicial notices. Any change to this domicile shall not be recognized unless the change is registered in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig>. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may establish branches, agencies, or offices for it within the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> or abroad.
### Article (3)
The duration of this company is unlimited and commences from the date of registration.
### Article (4)
Without prejudice to the provisions of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig> and its amendments and executive regulations, the purposes for which the company was established are:
1 – Investing its funds in trading shares, bonds, and other securities.
2 – Owning real estate and movable assets necessary for conducting its business within the limits permitted by law.
3 – Financing or lending to companies in which it owns shares or stakes, and guaranteeing them to third parties. In this case, the holding company's participation in the capital of the borrowing company must not be less than 20 percent.
4 – Owning intellectual property rights such as patents, trademarks, industrial designs, franchises, and other intangible rights, and exploiting and leasing them to its subsidiary holding companies and others.
The company shall have the right to conduct the aforementioned activities in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and abroad, either directly or by agency. The company may also engage in activities that are common, complementary, necessary, or related to its stated purposes.
### Article (5)
B – Capital and Methods of Increasing It
### Article (5)
The company's issued capital is set at (K.D. 2,400,000) <orig>2400000 د.ك.</orig> (Two Million Four Hundred Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only), distributed over (2,400,000) (Two Million Four Hundred Thousand shares), with each share valued at (K.D. 1) <orig>1 د.ك.</orig> (One Dinar <orig>دينار</orig>).
The company's authorized capital is set at (K.D. 2,400,000) <orig>2400000 د.ك.</orig> (Two Million Four Hundred Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only).
The company's capital consists of cash shares paid as follows:
Paid-up capital (K.D. 2,400,000) <orig>2400000 د.ك.</orig> (Two Million Four Hundred Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only) was paid by the company to Warba Bank <orig>بنك وربة</orig> as per the certificate issued by the said bank dated 06/08/2024 (and attached to the original of this contract).
The company's capital is set at K.D. 2,400,000 <orig>2400000 د.ك.</orig> (Two Million Four Hundred Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only).
### Article (6)
The company's shares are foreign (may be owned) by non-Kuwaitis in accordance with the provisions of the law and relevant ministerial decisions.
### Article (7)
The authorized capital may not be increased unless the value of the original shares has been fully paid. The Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> may authorize the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> to determine the date of its implementation. However, by a resolution of the company's Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, the issued capital may be increased within the limits of the authorized capital, provided that the issued capital has been fully paid.
New shares may not be issued for less than their nominal value.
### Article (8)
If the value of the original shares has been fully paid, the company's authorized capital may be increased by a resolution issued by the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> after obtaining the approval of the regulatory authorities <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig>, based on a reasoned proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and a report from the auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig> in this regard, provided that the resolution issued for the capital increase specifies the amount and methods of the increase.
### Article (9)
The company's capital is set at K.D. 2,400,000 <orig>2400000 د.ك.</orig> – Two Million Four Hundred Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only.

If it is decided to increase the company's capital and some shareholders do not exercise their pre-emptive right to subscribe to the capital increase shares, the unsubscribed shares shall be allocated to those shareholders of the company who wish to subscribe. If the subscription requests exceed the number of shares offered, they shall be allocated to the subscribers in proportion to their subscription.
In all cases where the new shares are not fully subscribed, the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may allocate the unsubscribed shares to new shareholders, and the unsubscribed new shares shall be considered null and void by operation of law.
### Article (10)
The company may increase its capital through public subscription <orig>الاكتتاب العام</orig> as stipulated in Article (160) of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig> and its amendments and executive regulations.
### Article (11)
The shareholder's right to dispose of their shares is restricted by one or both of the following restrictions:
1 . Requiring a pre-emptive right for the company's shareholders to purchase shares that their owner wishes to sell.
2 . Requiring the approval of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> for the share purchaser.

Dispositions referred to in Article (172) of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> are excluded from these two restrictions. (This text does not apply to companies listed on the stock exchange).
Article (12)
(Mandatory text if the first restriction in Article 11 of this Bylaw is adopted)
Before disposing of his shares, the shareholder must notify the company of the terms of sale. The disposition of shares shall not be effective until ten days have elapsed from the date of notification without any of the shareholders submitting a request to purchase the shares. If a shareholder submits a request to purchase the shares, it must be done at the price stated in the terms of sale.
Article (13)
(Mandatory text if the second restriction in Article 11 of this Bylaw is adopted)
Without prejudice to the provisions regarding the company's purchase of its own shares, the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, in the event of rejecting the buyer's person, must purchase the shares on behalf of the company within ten days from the date the Board <orig>المجلس</orig> is notified of the approval request. In this case, the purchase shall be at the price agreed upon by the shareholder for the sale of his shares.
Article (14)
Subscription
Article (14)
The founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> who signed the Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> subscribed to the entire capital of the company with shares totaling (2,400,000) (two million four hundred thousand shares) with a nominal value of (one Dinar <orig>دينار</orig>) distributed among them, each according to their subscription ratio specified in the Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig>. The nominal value of the shares they subscribed to has been paid at Warba Bank <orig>بنك وربة</orig> as per the attached bank certificate dated 06/08/2024 AD.
Article (15)
Ownership of a share necessarily entails the shareholder's acceptance of the Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig>, the provisions of the company's Bylaws <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>, and the resolutions of its General Assemblies <orig>جمعياتها العامة</orig>.
Article (16)
Every share entitles its owner to an equal share without discrimination in the ownership of the company's assets and in distributed profits.
Article (17)
The company shall have a special register kept with a clearing agency <orig>وكالة مقاصة</orig>, in which the names of shareholders, their nationalities, domiciles, the number and type of shares owned by each, and the value paid for each share shall be recorded.
Any changes occurring to the data recorded therein shall be endorsed in the shareholders' register according to the information received by the company or the clearing agency <orig>وكالة المقاصة</orig>. Any interested party may request the company or the clearing agency <orig>وكالة المقاصة</orig> to provide them with the data from this register.
Article (18)
Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig>
Within three months from the date of subscription and before the meeting of the Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig>, the founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> must submit to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> a statement detailing the number of subscribed shares, the names and addresses of subscribers, the number of shares subscribed by each, and the value paid thereof.
Article (19)
The founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> must invite the Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> to convene within three months from the date of completion of the subscription. If the period expires without the Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> being held, the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> shall, within fifteen days from the date of expiry of the said period,
convene the Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig>.
Article (20)
The invitation to attend the meeting of the Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig>, including the agenda, time, and place of the meeting, shall be sent by one of the following methods:
1. Registered letters sent to all subscribers at least two weeks before the scheduled date of the meeting.
2. Announcement, and the announcement must be made twice, provided that the second announcement is made after a period of no less than seven days from the date of publication of the first announcement and at least seven days before the meeting.
3. Hand delivery of the invitation to shareholders or their legal representatives at least one day before the meeting, with an endorsement on a copy of the invitation confirming receipt.
4. Any other modern means of communication specified in the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig> of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>.
The Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> must be notified in writing of the agenda, time, and place of the meeting at least seven days before its convening for its representative to attend.
The meeting of the Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> shall be chaired by whomever the Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> elects for this purpose.
Article (21)
The meeting of the Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> shall not be valid unless attended by shareholders with voting rights representing more than half of the subscribed shares. If this quorum is not met, the Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> must be invited to a second meeting with the same agenda, to be held within a period of no less than seven days and no more than thirty days from the date of the first meeting. The second meeting shall be valid regardless of the number of attendees.
A new invitation for the second meeting is not required if its date was specified in the invitation to the first meeting. Resolutions shall be issued by an absolute majority of the shares present at the meeting.
Article (22)
The founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> shall submit to the Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> a report containing comprehensive information about all incorporation operations and the amounts expended, along with supporting documents. This report shall be placed in a location designated by the founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> for subscribers to review, at least seven days before the Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> meeting, and this shall be indicated in the invitation to subscribers to attend the meeting:
Article (23)
The Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> shall be competent to address the following matters:
1. Approving the company's incorporation procedures after verifying their validity and conformity with the provisions of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> and the company's Articles of Association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>.
2. Approving the valuation of in-kind contributions, if any, as stipulated in Article (11) of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>.
3. Electing the first Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>.
4. Appointing the auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig> and determining their fees.
5. Declaring the final incorporation of the company.
A copy of the minutes of the Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> meeting, including the resolutions adopted, shall be sent to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
The first Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must publish the company's Articles of Association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig> and register it in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> within thirty days from the date of the final declaration of the company's incorporation.
Article (24)
Rights and Obligations of Shareholders
A member of the company shall specifically enjoy the following rights:
- In accordance with its purposes, and this authority shall only be limited by what is stipulated by law, these Bylaws <orig>النظام</orig>, or the resolutions of the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may sell any of the company's assets and real estate, as well as mortgage them, issue guarantees, conclude loans, donations, gifts, releases, arbitration, reconciliation, and approve controlling participations.
<page_end>152</page_end>

**Article (30)**
The company may have a Chief Executive Officer appointed by the Board of Directors from among its members or from outside, who shall be entrusted with the management of the company. The Board shall define his/her powers and authorities to sign on behalf of the company.

**Article (31)**
The Board of Directors may distribute work among its members according to the nature of the company's business. The Board may also delegate one of its members, a committee from among its members, or a third party to perform one or more specific tasks, supervise any aspect of the company's activity, or exercise some of the powers or authorities vested in the Board.

**Article (32)**
Any shareholder, whether a natural or legal person, may appoint representatives to the company's Board of Directors in proportion to their shareholding. The number of Board members selected in this manner shall be deducted from the total number of Board members to be elected. Shareholders who have participated in the election of the remaining Board members with other shareholders may only do so to the extent exceeding the proportion used for appointing their representatives to the Board. A group of shareholders may form an alliance among themselves to appoint one or more representatives to the Board of Directors, in proportion to their combined ownership.
These representatives shall have the same rights and duties as elected members, and the shareholder shall be responsible for the actions of their representatives towards the company, its creditors, and its shareholders.

**Article (33)**
A meeting of the Board of Directors shall not be valid unless attended by half of the members, provided that the number of attendees is not less than three. A higher percentage or number may be agreed upon. Meetings may be held using modern communication means, and decisions may be passed by circulation with the approval of all Board members.
The Board of Directors must meet at least six times during the year, and a greater number of meetings may be agreed upon.

**Article (34)**
Minutes of the Board of Directors meetings shall be recorded and signed by the attending members and the Board Secretary. Any member who did not approve a decision taken by the Board may record their objection in the meeting minutes.

**Article (35)**
If a Board member's position becomes vacant, it shall be filled by the shareholder who received the highest number of votes among those who did not win Board membership. If that person is prevented from taking the position, it shall be filled by the next in line. The new member shall complete only the term of their predecessor.
However, if the vacant positions reach one-quarter of the original positions, the Board of Directors must call for a General Assembly of shareholders to convene within two months from the date the last position became vacant, to elect those who will fill the vacant positions.

**Article (36)**
The following conditions must be met by anyone nominated for Board membership:
1. Must possess legal capacity to act.
2. Must not have been previously convicted of a felony with a freedom-restricting penalty or a bankruptcy offense.
1. Receiving dividends and obtaining bonus shares decided for distribution.
2. Participating in the company's management through Board membership and attending General Assemblies and participating in their deliberations, in accordance with the provisions of the Companies Law and these Articles of Association. Any agreement to the contrary is null and void.
3. Obtaining, at least seven days before the General Assembly meeting, the company's financial statements for the past accounting period, the Board of Directors' report, and the Auditor's report.
4. Disposing of owned shares and priority in subscribing to new shares.
5. Obtaining a share of the company's assets upon liquidation after settling its debts.

**Article (25)**
The member in the company is particularly obligated to:
1. Pay the installments due on their shares upon their due dates and pay compensation for delay in payment.
2. Pay the expenses incurred by the company to collect unpaid installments on the value of their shares, and the company has the right to enforce on the shares to satisfy its rights.
3. Implement the decisions issued by the company's General Assembly.
4. Refrain from any act that harms the financial or moral interests of the company and commit to compensating for damages arising from violating this.

**Article (26)**
The General Assembly of Shareholders may not do the following:
1. Increase the financial burdens of the shareholder or increase the nominal value of the share.
2. Decrease the percentage of net profits to be distributed to shareholders as specified in the company's Articles of Association.
3. Impose new conditions, other than those mentioned in the Memorandum of Association or these Articles, related to the shareholder's right to attend and vote in General Assemblies.
4. These provisions may be deviated from with the written acceptance of all shareholders or by a unanimous vote involving all shareholders, and by completing the necessary procedures for amending the company's Articles of Association.

**Article (27)**
A- Board of Directors
The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors consisting of (5) five members. The term of membership shall be three years, renewable.
If it is not possible to elect a new Board of Directors within the specified period, the existing Board shall continue to manage the company's affairs until the reasons cease and a new Board of Directors is elected.

**Article (28)**
Shareholders shall elect the members of the Board of Directors by secret ballot. The company's Articles of Association may stipulate that a number not exceeding half of the first Board of Directors members shall be elected from among the company's founders.

**Article (29)**
The Board of Directors shall elect by secret ballot a Chairman and a Vice-Chairman. The Chairman of the Board of Directors shall represent the company in its relations with third parties and before the judiciary, in addition to other powers specified in the Articles of Association. His/her deputies shall be entrusted with managing the company's affairs in its relations with third parties, and he/she must implement the Board's decisions. The Vice-Chairman shall act in place of the Chairman in his/her absence or if he/she is prevented from exercising his/her powers. The Board of Directors shall have the broadest powers to manage the company and perform all acts required for the company's management.

3. To personally own or represent the owner of (20,000) twenty thousand shares of the company's stock.
If a member of the Board of Directors loses any of the aforementioned conditions, their membership shall cease.

### Article (37)
Membership in the company's Board of Directors shall not be included within the maximum number of memberships referred to in Article (234) of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>.
A person may be the chairman of the board of directors of more than one closed joint-stock company.

### Article (38)
The chairman or a member of the Board of Directors, even if representing a natural or legal person, may not exploit information obtained by virtue of their position to gain benefit for themselves or others.
A member of the Board of Directors may dispose of their shares in the company during their membership on the Board, without prejudice to the restrictions on the disposal of shares stipulated in the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>, the company's articles of association, or these bylaws.

### Article (39)
Members of the Board of Directors may not disclose to shareholders, outside of General Assembly meetings, or to third parties, any company secrets they have become aware of due to their management, otherwise they shall be subject to dismissal and held accountable for compensating damages resulting from the violation.

### Article (40)
The chairman of the Board of Directors or any of its members may not combine membership in the board of directors of two competing companies, or participate in any work that would compete with the company, or conduct business for their own account or for the account of others in any branch of activity carried out by the company, otherwise the company shall have the right to demand compensation from them or to consider the operations they conducted for their own account as if they were conducted for the company's account, unless with the approval of the Ordinary General Assembly.

### Article (41)
The total remuneration of the chairman and members of the Board of Directors may not exceed ten percent of the net profit after deducting depreciation and distributing a profit of not less than 5% of the capital to shareholders (a higher percentage may be agreed upon).
An annual remuneration not exceeding six thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> may be distributed to the chairman of the Board of Directors and each member of this Board from the date of the company's establishment until the achievement of profits that allow it to distribute remuneration in accordance with the preceding paragraph. By a resolution issued by the company's General Assembly, an independent board member may be exempted from the aforementioned maximum remuneration limit (if the company has independent members).
The Board of Directors is obligated to submit an annual report to be presented to the company's Ordinary General Assembly for approval, which shall accurately include a detailed statement of the amounts, benefits, and advantages received by the Board of Directors, regardless of their nature or designation.

### Article (42)
No person representing on the Board of Directors, or the chairman, or a member of the Board of Directors, or a member of the executive management, or their spouses, or their second-degree relatives, may have a direct or indirect interest in contracts and dispositions concluded with or on behalf of the company, unless authorized by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly.

### Article (43)
The company may not lend to any of its Board members, or the CEO, or their spouses, or their relatives up to the second degree, or their affiliated companies, unless there is authorization from the company's General Assembly. Any action taken in violation thereof shall not be enforceable against the company, without prejudice to the rights of good faith third parties.
(This provision does not apply to companies authorized to lend).

### Article (44)
The chairman and members of the Board of Directors are responsible towards the company, shareholders, and third parties for all acts of fraud, abuse of authority, and for any violation of the law or the company's articles of association, or for errors in management.
Without filing a liability lawsuit, the General Assembly may not vote to discharge the Board of Directors from liability. Members of the Board of Directors may not participate in voting on General Assembly resolutions related to discharging them from liability for their management, or those related to a special benefit for them, their spouses, or their first-degree relatives, or to a dispute existing between them and the company.

### Article (45)
The liability stipulated in the preceding article shall be either personal liability affecting a specific member, or joint liability among all members of the Board of Directors. In the latter case, all members shall be jointly and severally liable for paying compensation, except for those who objected to the decision that incurred the liability and recorded their objection in the minutes.

### Article (46)
The company may file a liability lawsuit against the members of the Board of Directors due to errors that cause damage to the company. If the company is in liquidation, the liquidator shall undertake filing the lawsuit.

### Article (47)
Any shareholder may individually file a liability lawsuit on behalf of the company if the company fails to do so. In this case, the company must be joined as a party to be awarded compensation if applicable. A shareholder may file their personal lawsuit for compensation if the error has caused them damage. Any agreement to the contrary shall be null and void.
B – General Assembly

### Article (48)
The Ordinary Annual General Assembly shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors within three months following the end of the fiscal year, at the time and place designated by the Board of Directors. The Board may invite the General Assembly to a meeting whenever necessary. The Board of Directors must issue an invitation for the General Assembly to meet upon a reasoned request from a number of shareholders owning ten percent of the company's capital, or upon a request from the auditor, within fifteen days from the date of the request. The agenda shall be prepared by the inviting party.
The provisions related to the founding assembly stipulated in Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> No. 1 of 2016 and its amendments shall apply to the procedures for inviting the General Assembly, and the quorum for attendance and voting.

### Article (49)
Every shareholder, regardless of the number of their shares, has the right to attend the General Assembly and shall have a number of votes equal to the number of votes allocated to the same class of shares. A shareholder may not vote on their own behalf or on behalf of whom they represent in matters related to a special benefit for them, or a dispute existing between them and the company. Any condition or resolution contrary to this shall be null and void. A shareholder may delegate another to attend on their behalf by virtue of a special power of attorney or authorization.

Any person claiming a right over shares that conflicts with what is recorded in the company's shareholders' register may apply to the judge of urgent matters <orig>قاضي الأمور الوقتية</orig> to obtain an order on petition <orig>أمر على عريضة</orig> to deprive the disputed shares <orig>الأسهم المتنازع عليها</orig> of voting rights for a period determined by the judge issuing the order, or until the dispute is settled by the competent court <orig>المحكمة المختصة</orig>, in accordance with the procedures stipulated in the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات المدنية والتجارية</orig>.

Article (50)
The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meeting shall be chaired by the Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig>, or his deputy, or a person delegated by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> for that purpose, or a person elected by the General Assembly from among the shareholders or others.

Article (51)
Subject to the provisions of the law, the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> shall, in its annual meetings, take decisions on matters falling within its jurisdiction, and in particular the following:
1. The Board of Directors' report on the company's activities and financial position for the ended financial year.
2. The auditor's report on the company's financial statements.
3. A report on any violations observed by regulatory authorities <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig> and for which penalties were imposed on the company.
4. The company's financial statements.
5. The Board of Directors' proposals regarding profit distribution.
6. Discharging the Board of Directors' members <orig>أعضاء مجلس الإدارة</orig>.
7. Electing or dismissing members of the Board of Directors and determining their remuneration.
8. Appointing the company's auditor <orig>مراقب حسابات الشركة</orig>, determining their fees, or authorizing the Board of Directors to do so.
9. Reporting on transactions that have occurred or will occur with related parties <orig>الأطراف ذات الصلة</orig>, where related parties are defined according to international accounting principles.

Article (52)
By a resolution issued by the company's Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>, the chairman or one or more members of the Board of Directors may be dismissed, or the company's Board of Directors may be dissolved and a new Board of Directors elected, based on a proposal submitted by a number of shareholders owning no less than one-quarter of the company's issued capital <orig>رأسمال الشركة المصدر</orig>.
If a resolution is issued to dissolve the Board of Directors, and it is not possible to elect a new Board of Directors at the same meeting, the Assembly may decide either for the existing Board to continue managing the company's affairs until the new Board is elected, or to appoint a temporary administrative committee <orig>لجنة إدارية مؤقتة</orig> whose primary task shall be to call the General Assembly to elect the new Board, within one month of its appointment.

Article (53)
The Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> may not discuss matters not included in the agenda, unless they are urgent matters that arose after the agenda was prepared or became apparent during the meeting, or if requested by one of the regulatory authorities <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig>, the auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig>, or a number of shareholders owning five percent of the company's capital. If, during the discussion, it becomes apparent that the information related to some of the presented matters is insufficient, the General Assembly shall adjourn or postpone the meeting for a period not exceeding ten working days if requested by a number of shareholders representing one-quarter of the issued capital <orig>رأس المال المصدر</orig>. The postponed meeting shall be convened without the need for new invitation procedures.

Article (54)
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must implement the resolutions of the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, unless these resolutions violate the law, the articles of association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig>, or these regulations.
The Board of Directors must re-present the violating resolutions to the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> in a meeting called for the purpose of discussing the aspects of the violation.

Article (55)
The provisions related to the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> shall apply to the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig>, taking into account the provisions stipulated in the following articles:

Article (56)
The Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> or upon a reasoned request from shareholders representing fifteen percent of the company's issued capital <orig>رأسمال الشركة المصدر</orig> or from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>. The Board of Directors must invite the Extraordinary General Assembly to a meeting within thirty days from the date of submitting the request.
If the Board of Directors fails to invite the General Assembly within the period stipulated in the preceding paragraph, the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> shall call for the meeting within fifteen days from the date of expiry of the period referred to in the preceding paragraph.

Article (57)
The meeting of the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall not be valid unless attended by shareholders representing three-quarters of the company's issued capital <orig>رأسمال الشركة المصدر</orig>. If this quorum <orig>النصاب</orig> is not met, an invitation shall be extended for a second meeting, which shall be valid if attended by those representing more than half of the issued capital <orig>رأس المال المصدر</orig>.
Resolutions shall be issued by a majority exceeding half of the total shares of the company's issued capital.

Article (58)
Subject to other competencies stipulated by law, the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall be competent in the following matters:
1. Amending the company's articles of association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>.
2. Selling the entire project for which the company was established, or disposing of it in any other way.
3. Dissolving the company, or its merger, transformation, or division.
4. Increasing or decreasing the company's capital <orig>رأسمال الشركة</orig>.

Article (59)
Any resolution issued by the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall not be effective until the publication procedures <orig>إجراءات الشهر</orig> are completed.
The approval of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> must be obtained if the resolution relates to the company's name, objectives, or capital.

Article (60)
Any shareholder may file a lawsuit for the nullity of any resolution issued by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> or the Ordinary or Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية أو غير العادية</orig> that violates the law, the company's articles of association <orig>عقد تأسيس الشركة</orig>, or these regulations, or that is intended to harm the company's interests, and may claim compensation when necessary.
Furthermore, resolutions of the Ordinary and Extraordinary General Assemblies that prejudice the rights of the minority <orig>حقوق الأقلية</orig> may be challenged. The challenge shall be made by a number of the company's shareholders owning fifteen percent of the issued capital <orig>رأسمال الشركة المصدر</orig>, provided they were not among those who approved those resolutions.

Article (61)
The company shall be jointly and severally liable <orig>على سبيل التضامن</orig> for the debts of its subsidiary partners <orig>شركائها التابعة</orig> if the following conditions are met:
1. Insufficiency of the subsidiary company's funds to meet its obligations.
2. The company owns a percentage of the subsidiary company's capital that enables it to control the appointment of the majority of the Board of Directors' members or managers, or the resolutions issued by

3. The subsidiary company <orig>الشركة التابعة</orig> makes decisions or takes actions that aim to serve the interests of the parent and controlling company <orig>الشركة المالكة والمسيطرة</orig> and harm the interests of the subsidiary company <orig>الشركة التابعة</orig> or its creditors, and these actions are the primary cause of the subsidiary company's <orig>الشركة التابعة</orig> inability to fulfill its obligations, unless the closed company is responsible for the subsidiary company's <orig>الشركة التابعة</orig> debts based on another reason.

Article (62)
The company's fiscal year begins on the first of January and ends on the last of December of each year, with the exception of the first fiscal year, which begins from the date of the company's registration in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> and ends on December 31 of the following fiscal year.

Article (63)
Annually, by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> based on a proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, a percentage of not less than ten percent of the net profits shall be deducted to form a statutory reserve <orig>احتياطي إجباري</orig> for the company.
The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> may cease this deduction if the statutory reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الإجباري</orig> exceeds half of the company's issued capital <orig>رأسمال الشركة المصدر</orig>.
The statutory reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الإجباري</orig> may only be used to cover the company's losses or to ensure the distribution of dividends to shareholders at a rate not exceeding five percent of the paid-up capital <orig>رأسمال المدفوع</orig> in years when the company's profits do not allow for the distribution of this percentage, due to the absence of an optional reserve <orig>احتياطي اختياري</orig> that permits the distribution of this percentage of profits.
What has been deducted from the statutory reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الإجباري</orig> must be returned to it when the profits of subsequent years allow, unless this reserve exceeds half of the issued capital <orig>رأس المال المصدر</orig>.
Additionally, (1%) shall be deducted and allocated to the account of the Kuwait Foundation for the Advancement of Sciences <orig>مؤسسة الكويت للتقدم العلمي</orig> from the company's net profit.

Article (64)
Annually, a percentage shall be deducted from the non-net profits, determined by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> after consulting the auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig>, for the depreciation of the company's assets or to compensate for the decrease in their value. These funds shall be used to purchase necessary materials, machinery, and facilities or to repair them, and these funds may not be distributed to shareholders.

Article (65)
The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> must decide to deduct a percentage of the profits to meet the company's obligations under labor laws and social insurance.
A special fund may be established to assist the company's workers and employees.

Article (66)
Annually, by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> based on a proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, a percentage not exceeding ten percent of the net profits may be deducted to form an optional reserve <orig>احتياطي اختياري</orig> allocated for purposes determined by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig>.

Article (67)
The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, based on a proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, may distribute profits to shareholders at the end of the fiscal year. For this distribution to be valid, it must be from real profits, in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and this distribution shall not affect the company's paid-up capital <orig>رأس المال المدفوع</orig>.

Article (68)
Auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig>
The provisions of Articles 227 to 233 of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig> and its amendments shall apply.

Article (69)
At the end of each fiscal year, the company must prepare a consolidated balance sheet <orig>ميزانية مجمعة</orig> and statements of profit and loss for itself and all its subsidiary companies, accompanied by explanations and data as required by International Accounting Standards <orig>المعايير المحاسبية الدولية</orig>.

Article (70)
Dissolution and Liquidation of the Company <orig>انقضاء الشركة وتصفيتها</orig>
The company shall be dissolved by one of the matters stipulated in Articles 266 to 277 of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations.

Article (71)
The liquidation of the company shall be carried out as set forth in the provisions of Articles 278 to 295 of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations.

Article (72)
The provisions of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations shall apply to all matters not specifically provided for in the Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> or in these Bylaws <orig>النظام</orig>.

Article (73)
An original copy of this contract shall be kept at the company's head office and on its website. An original copy of this contract shall also be kept in the company's file with the competent department at the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.

Article (74)
The Founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> declare the following:
*   First: That they have subscribed to all shares and deposited the amount required by law to be paid from their value in one of the local banks at the company's disposal.
*   Second: That the in-kind contribution <orig>المخصص العيني</orig> has been valued in accordance with the provisions of the law, and it has been fully paid.
*   Third: That they have appointed the necessary administrative bodies for the management of the company.
*   Fourth: Preservation of the supporting papers and documents for the aforementioned declarations with the official instrument <orig>المحرر الرسمي</orig>.

Article (75)
This contract was drawn up based on the letter from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> No. [Number] and registered with the Contracts and Companies Control Department <orig>مراقبة العقود و الشركات</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> under automated number 6381635 on 2025/02/17.

Preamble
*** The founders acknowledge their legal capacity to establish a Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company <orig>شركة مساهمة كويتية مقفلة</orig> among themselves and their commitment to the rules stipulated for its establishment in accordance with the provisions of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations.
They also acknowledge their commitment to all rules stipulated for the establishment of the company in accordance with the provisions of the following articles:

### Article (1)
The preceding preamble is considered an integral part of this contract.

### Article (2)
The founders acknowledge that the company was established in accordance with the provisions of Companies Law No. (1) of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم (1) لسنة 2016</orig>, its amendments, its executive regulations, and the provisions of this contract.
The company shall acquire legal personality <orig>الشخصية الاعتبارية</orig> from the date of registration.
It shall not be permitted to commence its activities except from the date of registration and the approval of all regulatory authorities <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig> for its commencement of activity.

### Article (3)
Company Name / Hay'a Holding Company <orig>شركة هيئة القابضة</orig> - A Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company <orig>شركة مساهمة كويتية مقفلة</orig>.

### Article (4)
The company's main office is located in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and its domicile is in the State of Kuwait. The partners may transfer the main office to any other location within Kuwait, and open branches and agencies for the company inside and outside the State of Kuwait. The company may conduct the aforementioned activities in the State of Kuwait and abroad, either directly or by agency. The company may also engage in similar, complementary, necessary, or related activities to its stated purposes. The company's headquarters shall be considered its legal domicile <orig>الموطن القانوني</orig> for directing correspondence and judicial notices to it, and its data shall be recorded in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig>. Any change to this headquarters shall not be valid until it is registered in the Commercial Register.

### Article (5)
The company's duration is unlimited, commencing from the date of registration.

### Article (6)
Without prejudice to the provisions of Decree-Law No. 1/2016 <orig>المرسوم بقانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig> concerning Companies and its amendments – and its executive regulations, the purposes for which the company was established are:
1- Investing its funds in trading shares, bonds, and other securities.
2- Owning real estate and movable assets necessary for conducting its business within the limits permitted by law.
3- Financing or lending to companies in which it owns shares or stakes, and guaranteeing them to third parties. In this case, the holding company's participation percentage in the capital of the borrowing company must not be less than twenty percent.
4- Owning intellectual property rights <orig>حقوق الملكية الفكرية</orig> such as patents, trademarks, industrial designs, franchise rights, and other intangible rights, and exploiting and leasing them to its subsidiaries and others.
The company may conduct the aforementioned activities in the State of Kuwait and abroad, either directly or by agency. The company may also engage in similar, complementary, necessary, or related activities to its stated purposes.

### Article (7)
The company's fiscal year begins on the first of January and ends on the last of December of each year, with the exception of the first fiscal year, which begins from the date of the company's registration in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> and ends in December of the following fiscal year.

### Article (8)
The company's authorized capital <orig>رأس مال الشركة المصرح به</orig> is set at (KWD 2,100,000) only (Two Million One Hundred Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), distributed over (Twenty-One Million) shares, with each share valued at (One Hundred Fils). All shares are (cash shares). The issued capital <orig>رأس المال المصدر</orig> is (KWD 2,100,000) only (Two Million One Hundred Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) only. The company's capital consists of cash shares that have been fully paid by the company to the National Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت الوطني</orig> as per the letter issued on 19/1/2025.

### Article (11)
The founders signing this contract undertake to carry out all necessary procedures to complete the establishment of the company and commit to excluding and canceling fictitious and repeated subscription requests and taking the necessary measures to achieve this.
For this purpose, they have appointed Mr. Riyadh Abdullah Hamad Al-Khaled <orig>رياض عبد الله حمد الخالد</orig> to take legal actions, complete the necessary documents, and introduce amendments that official authorities deem necessary to be included in the contract or in the attached Articles of Association.
Within three months from the date of completion of the subscription and before the constituent assembly meeting, the founders must submit to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> a statement detailing the number of shares subscribed by each founder, their payment of due installments, their names, addresses, the share value, and the amount paid thereof.

### Article (12)
The company's founders are jointly and severally liable among themselves for compensating any damage incurred by the company, its shareholders, or third parties due to the invalidity of the company's contract.

# Article 1
## Company (Kuwaiti Holding)
Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company (K.S.C.C.)
Closed Company
Articles of Association
Establishment of the Company
A- Elements of Company Establishment

### Article (1)
The company was established in accordance with the provisions of Companies Law No. 1/2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations. These Articles of Association specify the owners of the shares, whose provisions are detailed hereinafter, as a Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company (K.S.C.C.).

### Article (2)
The company's head office and legal domicile are in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, which is the address considered valid for directing correspondence and judicial notices. Any change to this domicile is not valid unless registered in the Commercial Register. The Board of Directors may establish branches, agencies, or offices for it within the State of Kuwait or abroad.

### Article (3)
The duration of this company is unlimited and commences from the date of registration.

### Article (4)
The purposes for which the company was established are: Without prejudice to the provisions of Companies Law No. 1/2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations:
-1 Investing its funds in trading shares, bonds, and other securities.
-2 Owning real estate and movable assets necessary for its operations within the limits permitted by law.
-3 Financing or lending to companies in which it owns shares or stakes, and guaranteeing them to third parties. In this case, the holding company's participation in the capital of the borrowing company must not be less than twenty percent.
-4 Owning intellectual property rights such as patents, trademarks, industrial designs, franchise rights, and other intangible rights, and exploiting and leasing them to its subsidiary holding companies and others.

### Article (5)
B- Capital and Methods of Increasing It

The authorized capital is set at (2,100,000 K.D.) <orig>2100,000 د.ك</orig> (Two Million One Hundred Thousand Dinars), the issued capital is (2,100,000 K.D.) (Two Million One Hundred Thousand Dinars), and the paid-up capital is (2,100,000 K.D.) (Two Million One Hundred Thousand Dinars). The company's issued capital consists of 21,000,000 cash shares with a value of 2,100,000 K.D. (Two Million One Hundred Thousand Dinars), which have been fully paid.

### Article (6)
The company's shares are nominal (not permissible) for Kuwaitis to own them in accordance with the provisions of the law and relevant ministerial decisions.

### Article (7)
The authorized capital may not be increased unless the value of the original shares has been fully paid. The Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> may authorize the Board of Directors to determine the date of its implementation, provided that the issued capital may be within the limits of issuing new shares at less than their nominal value.

### Article (8)
If the value of the original shares has been fully paid, the company's authorized capital may be increased by a resolution issued by the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> after obtaining the approval of the regulatory authorities <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig>, based on a reasoned proposal from the Board of Directors and a report from the auditor in this regard, provided that the resolution issued for the capital increase specifies the amount and methods of the increase.

### Article (9)
The company's capital is set at 2,100,000 K.D. <orig>2100000 د.ك</orig> - Two Million One Hundred Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only.

Optional Text

### Article (11)
(Mandatory text if the first restriction of Article 11 of these Articles of Association is adopted)
A shareholder must notify the company of the terms of sale before disposing of their shares. The disposal of shares shall not be effective until ten days have elapsed from the date of notification without any of the shareholders submitting a request to purchase the shares. If a shareholder submits a request to purchase the shares, the purchase must be made at the price stated in the terms of sale.

### Article (12)
(Mandatory text if the second restriction of Article 11 of these Articles of Association is adopted)
Without prejudice to the provisions regarding the company's purchase of its own shares, the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, in the event of rejecting the buyer, must purchase the shares on behalf of the company within ten days from the date the Board <orig>المجلس</orig> is notified of the request for approval. In this case, the purchase shall be made at the price agreed upon by the shareholder for the sale of their shares.

### Article (13)
Subscription
The founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> who signed the Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> subscribed to the entire capital of the company with 21,000,000.00 shares (twenty-one million shares) with a nominal value of K.D. 100.100 (one million one hundred thousand K.D.) distributed among them, each according to their subscription ratio specified in the Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig>. K.D. 2,100,000 (two million one hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) of the nominal value of the shares they subscribed to has been paid to the National Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت الوطني</orig>, as per the attached bank certificate dated 2025/01/19 CE.

### Article (14)
Ownership of a share necessarily entails the shareholder's acceptance of the Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig>, the provisions of the company's Articles of Incorporation <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>, and the resolutions of its General Assemblies <orig>جمعياتها العامة</orig>.

### Article (15)
Each share grants its owner the right to an equal share as others, without discrimination, in the ownership of the company's assets and in the distributed profits.

### Article (16)
The company shall maintain a special register with a clearing agency <orig>وكالة مقاصة</orig> in which the names of shareholders, their nationalities, domiciles, the number and type of shares owned by them, and the value paid for each share shall be recorded.
Any changes occurring to the data recorded in the shareholders' register shall be endorsed therein according to the information received by the company or the clearing agency <orig>وكالة مقاصة</orig>. Any interested party may request the company or the clearing agency <orig>وكالة مقاصة</orig> to provide them with the data from this register.

### Article (17)
Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig>
Within three months from the date of subscription and before the meeting of the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig>, the founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> must submit to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> a statement detailing the number of subscribed shares, the payment of due installments by subscribers, the names and addresses of subscribers, the number of shares subscribed by each, the value of the share, and the amount paid thereof.

### Article (18)
The founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> must invite the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> to convene within three months from the date of completion of the subscription. If the period expires without the Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> being held, the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> shall, within fifteen days from the date of expiry of the said period, invite the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> to convene.

### Article (19)
The invitation to attend the meeting of the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig>, including the agenda, time, and place of the meeting, shall be sent by one of the following methods:
- 1- Registered letters sent to all subscribers at least two weeks before the scheduled date of the meeting.
- 2- Announcement, which must be made twice, provided that the second announcement is made after a period of no less than seven days from the date of publication of the first announcement and at least seven days before the meeting.
- 3- Hand delivery of the invitation to shareholders or their legal representatives at least one day before the meeting, with an endorsement on a copy of the invitation confirming receipt.
- 4- Any other modern means of communication specified in the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig> of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>. The Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> must be notified in writing of the agenda, date, and place of the meeting at least seven days before its convening for its representative to attend.
The meeting of the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> shall be chaired by whomever the Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> elects for this purpose.

The meeting of the Constituent

4 / Disposing of shares owned by him and priority in subscribing to new shares.
5 / Obtaining a share of the company's assets upon liquidation after settling its debts.

Article (24)
A member of the company is particularly obligated to:
1 / Pay the installments due on his shares when they become due and pay compensation for delay in payment.
2 / Pay expenses incurred by the company to collect unpaid installments of his share value, and the company has the right to execute on his shares to satisfy its rights.
3 / Implement the resolutions issued by the company's General Assembly.
4 / Refrain from any act that harms the financial or moral interests of the company and commit to compensating for damages arising from violating this.

Article (25)
The General Assembly of Shareholders may not:
1 / Increase the financial burdens of the shareholder or increase the nominal value of the share.
2 / Decrease the percentage of net profits to be distributed to shareholders as stipulated in the company's articles of association.
3 / Impose new conditions other than those mentioned in the articles of incorporation or these regulations concerning the shareholder's right to attend and vote in General Assemblies.
These provisions may be deviated from with the written consent of all shareholders or by a unanimous vote involving all shareholders, and by completing the necessary procedures for amending the company's articles of association.

Article (26)
A - Board of Directors
The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors consisting of (5) members, and the term of membership shall be three years, renewable.
If it is not possible to elect a new Board of Directors within the specified period, the existing Board shall continue to manage the company's affairs until the reasons cease and a new Board of Directors is elected.

Article (27)
Shareholders shall elect the members of the Board of Directors by secret ballot. The company's articles of association may stipulate that no more than half of the first Board of Directors members shall be elected from among the company's founders.

Article (28)
The Board of Directors shall elect by secret ballot a Chairman and a Vice-Chairman. The Chairman of the Board of Directors shall represent the company in its relations with third parties and before the judiciary, in addition to other powers specified in the articles of association. His signature shall be considered as the signature of the Board of Directors in the company's relations with third parties. He shall implement the Board's resolutions and adhere to its recommendations. The Vice-Chairman shall act in place of the Chairman in his absence or if he is prevented from exercising his powers.

Article (29)
The company may have a Chief Executive Officer appointed by the Board of Directors from among its members or from others, who shall be entrusted with the management of the company, and whose allowances and powers to sign on behalf of the company shall be determined.

Article (30)
The Board of Directors may distribute work among its members according to the nature of the company's business. The Board may also delegate one of its members, a committee from among its members, or a third party to perform one or more specific tasks, supervise an aspect of the company's activity, or exercise some of the powers or competencies entrusted to the Board.

Article (31)
Any shareholder, whether a natural or legal person, may appoint representatives to the company's Board of Directors in proportion to the shares they own in it. The number of Board members selected in this manner shall replace a corresponding number from the total elected Board members. Shareholders who are represented on the Board of Directors may not participate with other shareholders in electing the remaining Board members except to the extent exceeding the proportion used in appointing their representatives to the Board of Directors. A group of shareholders may form an alliance among themselves to appoint one or more representatives for them on the Board of Directors, in proportion to their combined ownership.
These representatives shall have the same rights and duties as elected members.
The shareholder shall be responsible for the actions of their representative towards the company, its creditors, and its shareholders.

Article (32)
A meeting of the Board of Directors shall not be valid unless attended by half of the members, provided that the number of attendees is not less than three. A higher percentage or number may be agreed upon. Meetings may be held using modern communication means, and resolutions may be passed by circulation with the approval of all Board members.
The Board of Directors must meet at least four times during the year, and a greater number of meetings may be agreed upon.

Article (33)
Minutes of Board of Directors meetings shall be recorded and signed by the attending members and the Board Secretary. Any member who did not approve a resolution taken by the Board may record their objection in the meeting minutes.

Article (34)
If a Board of Directors member's position becomes vacant, they shall be succeeded by the shareholder who received the most votes among those who did not win Board membership. If that person is prevented, they shall be succeeded by the next in line. The new member shall complete only the term of their predecessor.
However, if the vacant positions reach one-quarter of the original positions, the Board of Directors must call a General Assembly of Shareholders to convene within two months from the date of the last vacancy, to elect those who will fill the vacant positions.

Article (35)
The following conditions must be met by anyone nominated for Board of Directors membership:
1 - Must not have been previously convicted of a felony with a custodial sentence, or a crime of bankruptcy due to negligence or fraud, or a crime against honor or trust, or a custodial sentence for violating the provisions of the law, unless their rehabilitation has been restored.

If a member of the Board of Directors loses any of the aforementioned conditions, their membership shall cease.

### Article (36)
Membership in the company's Board of Directors shall not be included within the maximum number of memberships referred to in Article (234). A person may be the chairman of the Board of Directors of more than one closed joint-stock company.

### Article (37)
The Chairman or a member of the Board of Directors, even if representing a natural or legal person, may not exploit information obtained by virtue of their position to gain benefit for themselves or others.
A member of the Board of Directors may dispose of their shares in the company during their membership in the Board, without prejudice to the restrictions on the disposal of shares stipulated in the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>, the company's articles of association, or these regulations.

### Article (38)
Members of the Board of Directors may not disclose to shareholders, outside of General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meetings, or to third parties, any company secrets they have become aware of due to their management of the company. Otherwise, they shall be subject to dismissal and held accountable for compensating damages resulting from the violation.

### Article (39)
The Chairman of the Board of Directors or any member of the Board may not combine membership in the board of directors of two competing companies, or participate in any work that would compete with the company, or trade for their own account or for the account of others in any branch of activity carried out by the company.
If they do so, the company may demand compensation or consider the operations they carried out for their own account as having been for the company's account, unless this is done with the approval of the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>.

### Article (40)
The total remuneration of the Chairman and members of the Board of Directors may not exceed ten percent of the net profit after deducting depreciation and reserves and distributing a profit of not less than 5% of the capital to shareholders (a higher percentage may be agreed upon).
An annual remuneration not exceeding six thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> may be distributed to the Chairman of the Board of Directors and each member of this Board from the date of the company's establishment until the achievement of profits that allow for the distribution of remuneration in accordance with the preceding paragraph. By a resolution issued by the company's General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, independent Board members may be exempted from the aforementioned maximum remuneration limit (if the company has independent members).
The Board of Directors is obligated to submit an annual report to the company's General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> for approval, which must accurately and in detail include the amounts, benefits, and advantages obtained by the Board of Directors, regardless of their nature or designation.

### Article (41)
No representative on the Board of Directors, nor the Chairman, nor any member of the Board of Directors, nor any member of the executive management, nor their spouses, nor their second-degree relatives, may have a direct or indirect interest in contracts and dispositions concluded with or on behalf of the company, unless authorized by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>.

### Article (42)
The company may not lend to any of its Board members, the Chief Executive Officer <orig>الرئيس التنفيذي</orig>, their spouses, their relatives up to the second degree, or their affiliated companies, unless there is authorization from the company's General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>. Any action taken in violation thereof shall not be enforceable against the company, without prejudice to the rights of good faith third parties.

### Article (43)
The Chairman and members of the Board of Directors are responsible towards the company, shareholders, and third parties for all acts of fraud, abuse of power, and for any violation of the law or the company's articles of association, or for errors in management.
A vote by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> to discharge the Board of Directors from liability shall not prevent the filing of a liability lawsuit. Members of the Board of Directors may not participate in voting on General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> resolutions concerning their discharge from liability or those related to a special benefit for them, their spouses, or their first-degree relatives, or a dispute existing between them and the company.

### Article (44)
The liability stipulated in the preceding article shall be either personal liability attaching to a specific member, or joint liability among all members of the Board of Directors. In the latter case, all members shall be jointly and severally liable for compensation, except for those who objected to the decision that incurred the liability and recorded their objection in the minutes.

### Article (45)
The company may file a liability lawsuit against the members of the Board of Directors due to errors that cause damage to the company. If the company is in liquidation, the liquidator shall undertake to file the lawsuit.

### Article (46)
Any shareholder may individually file a liability lawsuit on behalf of the company if the company fails to do so. In this case, the company must be joined as a party to the lawsuit so that compensation may be awarded to it if warranted. A shareholder may also file their personal lawsuit for compensation if the error has caused them damage. Any agreement to the contrary shall be null and void.

### Article (47)
B – General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>
The Ordinary Annual General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية السنوية</orig> shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors within three months following the end of the fiscal year, at the time and place designated by the Board of Directors. The Board may invite the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> to a meeting whenever necessary. The Board of Directors must issue an invitation for the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> to meet upon a reasoned request from shareholders owning ten percent of the company's capital, or upon a request from the auditor, within fifteen days from the date of the request. The agenda shall be determined, and the provisions related to the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> stipulated in Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig> and its amendments shall apply to the procedures for inviting the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> and the quorum for attendance and voting.
<page_end>161</page_end>

Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> Issue 1734, Seventy-First Year
Sunday, 13 Shawwal 1446 AH - 13/4/2025 AD
146
</header>
Every shareholder, regardless of the number of shares they hold, has the right to attend the General Assembly, and shall have a number of votes equal to the number of votes allocated to the same class of shares. A shareholder may not vote on their own behalf or on behalf of someone they represent in matters related to their personal interest, or in a dispute existing between them and the company. Any condition or decision that violates this shall be null and void. A shareholder may delegate another person to attend on their behalf by virtue of a special power of attorney or an authorization provided by the company for this purpose.
Anyone claiming a right over shares that conflicts with what is recorded in the company's shareholder register may apply to the judge of urgent matters <orig>قاضي الأمور الوقتية</orig> to obtain an order on petition to deprive the disputed shares of voting rights for a period determined by the judge or until the dispute is settled by the competent court, in accordance with the procedures stipulated in the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات المدنية والتجارية</orig>.

### Article (49)
Optional Text
Voting for candidates for membership of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall be subject to the cumulative voting system, which grants each shareholder voting power equal to the number of shares they own, entitling them to cast these votes for one or more candidates or distribute them among the candidates they choose without duplicating these votes.

### Article (50)
The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meeting shall be chaired by the Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig>, or their deputy, or someone delegated by the Board of Directors for that purpose, or someone elected by the General Assembly from among the shareholders or others.

### Article (51)
Subject to the provisions of the law, the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> shall, in its annual meeting, be competent to take decisions on matters falling within its jurisdiction, and in particular the following:
1 - The auditor's report <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig> on the company's financial statements.
2 - The Board of Directors' report on the company's activities and financial position for the ended fiscal year.
3 - A report on any violations observed by regulatory authorities <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig> and for which penalties were imposed on the company.
4 - The company's financial statements.
5 - The Board of Directors' proposals regarding profit distribution.
6 - Discharging the liability of the members of the Board of Directors.
7 - Electing or dismissing members of the Board of Directors and determining their remuneration.
8 - Appointing the company's auditor, determining their fees, or authorizing the Board of Directors to do so.
9 - Reporting on transactions that have occurred or will occur with related parties. Related parties are defined according to International Accounting Standards <orig>مبادئ المحاسبة الدولية</orig>.

### Article (52)
By a resolution issued by the company's Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>, the chairman or one or more members of the Board of Directors may be dismissed, or the company's Board of Directors may be dissolved and a new Board of Directors elected, based on a proposal submitted by a number of shareholders owning no less than one-quarter of the company's issued capital.
Upon the issuance of a resolution to dissolve the Board of Directors, and appoint a new board at the same meeting, the Assembly may decide either for this board to continue managing the company's affairs until the new board is elected, or to appoint a temporary administrative committee <orig>لجنة إدارية مؤقتة</orig> whose primary task shall be to convene the General Assembly to elect the new board, within one month of its appointment.

### Article (53)
The Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> may not discuss matters not included in the agenda unless they are urgent matters that arose after the agenda was prepared or became apparent during the meeting, or if requested by a regulatory authority <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig>, the auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig>, or a number of shareholders owning five percent of the company's capital. If, during the discussion, it becomes apparent that the information related to some presented matters is insufficient, the meeting shall be postponed for a period not exceeding ten working days if requested by a number of shareholders owning one-quarter of the issued capital. The postponed meeting shall be held without the need for new invitation procedures.

### Article (54)
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must implement the resolutions of the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> unless those resolutions violate the law, the articles of association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig>, or these regulations.
The Board of Directors must present the violating resolutions to the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> in a meeting convened to discuss the aspects of the violation.

### Article (55)
The provisions related to the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> shall apply to the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig>, taking into account the provisions stipulated in the following articles:

### Article (56)
The Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> or upon a reasoned request from shareholders owning fifteen percent of the company's issued capital or from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>. The Board of Directors must invite the Extraordinary General Assembly to a meeting within thirty days from the date of submitting the request.
If the Board of Directors fails to invite the General Assembly within the period stipulated in the preceding paragraph, the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> shall issue the invitation for the meeting within fifteen days from the expiry date of the period referred to in the preceding paragraph.

### Article (57)
The meeting of the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall not be valid unless attended by shareholders representing three-quarters of the company's issued capital. If this quorum is not met, an invitation shall be issued for a second meeting, which shall be valid if attended by those representing more than half of the issued capital. Resolutions shall be issued by a majority exceeding half of the total shares of the company's issued capital.

### Article (58)
Subject to other competencies stipulated by law, the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall be competent in the following matters:
1 - Amending the company's articles of association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>.
2 - Selling the entire project for which the company was established or disposing of it in any other way.
3 - Dissolving the company, or its merger, transformation, or division.
<page_end>162</page_end>
