4 - Increasing or decreasing the company's capital.

### Article (59)
Any resolution issued by the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall not be effective until the publication procedures are completed.
The approval of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> must be obtained if the resolution relates to the company's name, objectives, or capital.

### Article (60)
Any shareholder may file a lawsuit for the nullification of any resolution issued by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> or the Ordinary or Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية أو غير العادية</orig> if it violates the law, the company's articles of association, or these bylaws, or if it is intended to harm the company's interests, and may claim compensation when necessary.
Resolutions of the Ordinary and Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية وغير العادية</orig> that prejudice the rights of the minority may also be challenged. The challenge shall be made by a number of the company's shareholders owning fifteen percent of the issued capital, provided they were not among those who approved such resolutions.

### Article (61)
**For the Holding Company** <orig>الشركة القابضة</orig>
The company shall be jointly and severally liable for the debts of its subsidiary companies <orig>شركاتها التابعة</orig> if the following conditions are met:
1 - Insufficiency of the subsidiary company's <orig>الشركة التابعة</orig> funds to meet its obligations.
2 - The company owns a percentage of the subsidiary company's <orig>الشركة التابعة</orig> capital that enables it to control the appointment of Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> members or managers, or the decisions issued by the management.
3 - The subsidiary company <orig>الشركة التابعة</orig> makes decisions or takes actions that target the interest of the owning and controlling company and harm the interest of the subsidiary company <orig>الشركة التابعة</orig> or its creditors, and these actions are the primary reason for the subsidiary company's <orig>الشركة التابعة</orig> inability to meet its obligations.
All of the above applies unless the holding company <orig>الشركة القابضة</orig> is liable for the debts of the subsidiary company <orig>الشركة التابعة</orig> based on another reason.

### Article (62)
**Company Accounts** <orig>حسابات الشركة</orig>
The company's fiscal year <orig>السنة المالية</orig> begins on January 1st and ends on December 31st of each year, with the exception of the first fiscal year <orig>السنة المالية</orig>, which begins from the date of the company's registration in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> and ends on December 31st of the following fiscal year.

### Article (63)
Annually, by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> based on the proposal of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, a percentage of not less than ten percent of the net profits shall be deducted to form a statutory reserve <orig>احتياطي إجباري</orig> for the company.
The Assembly <orig>المجمعية</orig> may use the statutory reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الإجباري</orig> only to cover the company's losses or to ensure the distribution of dividends to shareholders at a rate not exceeding five percent of the paid-up capital <orig>رأس المال المدفوع</orig> in years when the company's profits do not allow for the distribution of this percentage, due to the absence of an optional reserve <orig>احتياطي اختياري</orig> that permits the distribution of this percentage of profits.
What has been deducted from the statutory reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الإجباري</orig> must be returned to it when the profits of subsequent years allow, unless this reserve exceeds half of the issued capital <orig>رأس المال المصدر</orig>.

### Article (64)
Annually, a percentage of 5% shall be deducted from the gross profits, or a percentage determined by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> after consulting the auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig>, for the depreciation of the company's assets or to compensate for their decrease in value. These funds shall be used to purchase necessary materials, machinery, and facilities or to repair them, and these funds may not be distributed to shareholders.

### Article (65)
The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> must decide to deduct a percentage of the profits to meet the company's obligations under labor laws <orig>قوانين العمل</orig> and social insurance <orig>التأمينات الاجتماعية</orig> laws.
A special fund may be established to assist the company's workers and employees.

### Article (66)
Annually, by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> based on the proposal of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, a percentage not exceeding ten percent of the net profits may be deducted to form an optional reserve <orig>احتياطي اختياري</orig> allocated for purposes determined by the Assembly.

### Article (67)
The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, based on the proposal of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, may distribute dividends to shareholders at the end of the fiscal year <orig>السنة المالية</orig>. For this distribution to be valid, it must be from actual profits, in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and must not affect the company's paid-up capital <orig>رأس المال المدفوع</orig>.

### Article (68)
**Auditor** <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig>
The provisions of Articles 227 to 233 of Companies Law No. 1/2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig> and its amendments shall apply.

### Article (69)
At the end of each fiscal year <orig>سنة مالية</orig>, the company must prepare a consolidated balance sheet of profits and losses for itself and all its subsidiary companies <orig>شركاتها التابعة</orig>, accompanied by explanations and data in accordance with international accounting standards.

### Article (70)
**Company Dissolution and Liquidation** <orig>انقضاء الشركة وتصفيتها</orig>
The company shall be dissolved by one of the matters stipulated in Articles 266 to 277 of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations.

### Article (71)
The company's liquidation shall be carried out as specified in the provisions of Articles 278 to 295 of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations.

### Article (72)
The provisions of Companies Law No. 1/2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig> and its executive regulations shall apply to all matters not specifically provided for in the articles of association or in these bylaws.

### Article (73)
An original copy of this contract shall be kept at the company's head office and on its website. An original copy of this contract shall also be kept in the company's file with the competent department at the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.

# Supreme Council for Planning and Development <orig>المجلس الأعلى للتخطيط والتنمية</orig>

Announcement

The General Secretariat <orig>الأمانة العامة</orig> announces its desire to issue Practice No. (9-2024/2025) related to the maintenance of devices and systems in the halls of the General Secretariat building of the Supreme Council for Planning and Development <orig>المجلس الأعلى للتخطيط والتنمية</orig>. Companies wishing to apply for this practice must observe the following:
1.  The company must be registered with the General Secretariat <orig>الأمانة العامة</orig> of the Supreme Council for Planning and Development <orig>المجلس الأعلى للتخطيط والتنمية</orig> and listed with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> before the issuance of this announcement.
2.  The applying company must have experience in this field, with proof thereof.
3.  The General Secretariat <orig>الأمانة العامة</orig> will begin issuing the practice terms starting from the date of the announcement's publication and for a period of ten working days.
4.  The practice terms can be obtained from the Financial Affairs Department <orig>إدارة الشؤون المالية</orig> for a fee of -- / 75 K.D. (only seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only).
5.  A preliminary meeting with the bidders will be held on Wednesday, 16/4/2025, at 10:00 AM in the General Secretariat <orig>الأمانة العامة</orig> building of the Supreme Council for Planning and Development <orig>المجلس الأعلى للتخطيط والتنمية</orig>.
6.  Bids must be submitted in a sealed envelope to the Financial Affairs Department <orig>إدارة الشؤون المالية</orig> no later than 1:00 PM on Thursday, 24/4/2025.

Announcement

Regarding the launch of a new electronic page on the official website of the State Audit Bureau <orig>ديوان المحاسبة</orig> in the Procurement Department <orig>قسم التوريدات</orig> for displaying direct purchase requests.
The State Audit Bureau <orig>ديوان المحاسبة</orig> announces the launch of a new electronic page on its official website, specifically for the Procurement Department <orig>قسم التوريدات</orig>, to display direct purchase requests. The State Audit Bureau <orig>ديوان المحاسبة</orig> offers all companies a new service through this page to view purchase requests and submit price offers, after registering the required data in the price offer request form, by following these steps:
1- Access the official Bureau website here (www.sab.gov.kw)
2- Select 'Electronic Services' item
3- Select 'For Companies' item
4- Select 'Direct Order' item
Then, proceed to register the data in the price offer form.
For inquiries, please contact the following number: 24957346 (WhatsApp account available on this number)

Announcement

Company Registration for the year 2025 as an Approved Supplier in the Suppliers Register <orig>سجل الموردين</orig> at the State Audit Bureau <orig>ديوان المحاسبة</orig>
The State Audit Bureau <orig>ديوان المحاسبة</orig> announces the opening of electronic registration for companies as approved suppliers in the Bureau's Suppliers Register <orig>سجل الموردين</orig>.
Accordingly, companies wishing to register are requested to attend the State Audit Bureau <orig>ديوان المحاسبة</orig> / Financial Affairs Department <orig>إدارة الشؤون المالية</orig> / Budget Section <orig>قسم الميزانية</orig> with the company details form attached (after electronically registering the company on the official Bureau website). Company registration will not be approved until the fee of 5 K.D. is paid. The payment receipt and registration form must be submitted to the Procurement Department <orig>قسم التوريدات</orig> for the company to be approved as a supplier for the current calendar year, renewable annually for the same fee.
*   Note: Follow the official State Audit Bureau <orig>ديوان المحاسبة</orig> website (www.sab.gov.kw) for any updates.
*   To register: Bureau Homepage --> Services

Seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>) non-refundable, payable by certified cheque. The specifications booklet shall be delivered at the (Information Technology Department) (Kuwait Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig> Headquarters - Sharq - Block 1, Street 201 - 26th Floor - Office No. 2611).
Bids shall be submitted during the Authority's official working hours starting from Sunday, 13/04/2025, with the last day for submission being Sunday, 04/05/2025. Bids must be submitted in sealed envelopes by the specified date before 1:00 PM (Kuwait Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig> Headquarters - Sharq - Block 1, Street 201 - 22nd Floor - Room No. 2217).
The practitioner must also attach the following documents with the bid:
1- A copy of the Commercial Register.
2- A copy of the certificate from the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>.
3- A copy of the company's registration receipt with the Kuwait Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig>.
4- A copy of the national labor percentage fulfillment certificate, valid for one year.
5- A copy of the registration receipt with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>.
6- A copy of the practice purchase receipt.
7- The initial guarantee for the practice, valued at (2%), in the form of a certified cheque or a letter of guarantee issued by one of the accredited banks in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> in favor of the Kuwait Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig>, unconditional and valid for at least (90) days from the last date for bid receipt.
8- Attachment of a certificate of payment of subscriptions to the Public Institution for Social Security <orig>المؤسسة العامة للتأمينات الاجتماعية</orig> as stipulated in Article (95) of the Social Security Law <orig>قانون التأمينات الاجتماعية</orig>.
9- Attachment of a valid "To Whom It May Concern" certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, stating that there is no suspension on the practitioner's file regarding government contracts registered with the private sector, noting that bids not including this certificate will be excluded.

# Bankruptcy Proceedings Report and Provisional List of Debts
## For the Bankruptcy of / Mahmoud Hussein Ali Mahmoud <orig>محمود حسين علي محمود</orig>
Submitted to the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> in Case No. 2012/24 Public Debts Bankruptcy/1, dated 2012/2/8

Pursuant to the judgment issued in Case No. 2012/24 Public Debts Bankruptcy/1 dated 2012/2/8, the bankruptcy of the bankrupt / Mahmoud Hussein Ali Mahmoud <orig>محمود حسين علي محمود</orig> was declared, and the judgment has become final and acquired the force of res judicata.
Whereas the aforementioned bank (Commercial Bank of Kuwait <orig>البنك التجاري الكويتي</orig>) stated in its letter dated 2019/9/23 that the debt of the aforementioned bankrupt amounts to 352,759.158 K.D. as of 1990/8/1, given that the debt value mentioned in the bankruptcy declaration judgment, which is 405,818.843 K.D., is as of 1991/12/31 and not as of 1990/8/1, considering that the error in the judgment is a material error, while the current initial data regarding the debt value are correct.
Based on the foregoing and in deference to the authority of judgments, the Kuwait Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig>, in its capacity as "The Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig>", relies on what was stated in the bankruptcy declaration judgment. The Authority, in its capacity as the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>, issued a decision by its letter dated 2025/2/24 approving the publication of the provisional list of debts as follows:
Debts that the Authority, in its capacity, deems acceptable:

<table_caption>Debts recognized by the Authority for Mahmoud Hussein Ali</table_caption>
<table>
| Description | Amount | Notes |
|:------|:------|:---|
| Commercial Bank of Kuwait <orig>البنك التجاري الكويتي</orig> | 405,818.843 K.D. | Pursuant to Bankruptcy Declaration Judgment No. 2012/24 dated 2012/2/8 as of 1990/8/1 |
</table>

Pursuant to the text of Article (111) of Law No. 71 of 2020 <orig>القانون رقم 71 لسنة 2020</orig>, "The debtor and any creditor whose name is not included in the list of debts have the right to appeal to the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> regarding the debts listed in the list within ten days from the date of the list's announcement."

The bidder <orig>الممارس</orig> must also submit with their bid a preliminary bond <orig>تأميناً أولياً</orig> in the form of a certified check <orig>شيك مصدق</orig> or an unconditional and irrevocable letter of guarantee <orig>خطاب ضمان غير مشروط</orig> issued in the name of the bidder from one of the banks approved by the State of Kuwait and in favor of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>, valid for the duration of the bid. Any bid not accompanied by the full amount of this bond shall be excluded. The preliminary bond <orig>التأمين الأولي</orig> shall not be refunded until (90) days have passed from the date of the closing of the practice <orig>الممارسة</orig> or when the winning bidder <orig>الممارس الفائز</orig> signs the contract, unless the practice <orig>الممارسة</orig> is cancelled. The Authority shall not pay any interest on the amount of this bond, and the bidder's creditors may not seize its amount, noting that this practice <orig>الممارسة</orig> is indivisible.

The Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> announces that the Allocation Committee <orig>لجنة التخصيص</orig> decided in its meeting No. (2025/3) held on 2023/3/13 to cancel Craft License <orig>الترخيص الحرفي</orig> No. 25757 issued to Mr. Ali Hassan Abdul Rahim <orig>علي حسن عبد الرحيم</orig> and to withdraw Craft Units <orig>الوحدات الحرفية</orig> No. (G17-G18) at Fahaheel Craft Complex <orig>مجمع الفحيحيل الحرفي</orig>.
Accordingly, the concerned parties must vacate the craft units <orig>الوحدات الحرفية</orig> within 10 days from the date of this announcement and hand them over to the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>, otherwise the Authority will be compelled to take its procedures for removal at the expense of the concerned party <orig>صاحب العلاقة</orig>, without prejudice to the Authority's right to claim any other compensation resulting therefrom from the concerned parties.

Anyone in possession of the aforementioned plot contract <orig>عقد القسيمة</orig> or having any information regarding it is requested to report to the headquarters of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>مقر الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> (Ground Floor), Licenses and Industrial Register Department <orig>قسم التراخيص والسجل الصناعي</orig>, within two weeks from the date of publication of this announcement. Otherwise, the Authority will proceed with issuing a replacement for the requested contract after the expiry of the deadline.

Announcement
The Public Authority for Civil Information <orig>الهيئة العامة للمعلومات المدنية</orig> announces that the residential addresses of the individuals listed below have been deleted due to construction (based on the declaration of the property owner or due to demolition of the building <orig>بناء على إقرار مالك السكن أو سبب هدم المبنى</orig>). This will be at the headquarters of the Bait Al-Mal <orig>بيت المال</orig> Control Department, which is affiliated with the Administration, located in Al-Sulaibiya <orig>الصليبية</orig> on the Sixth Ring Road.

Therefore, those wishing to purchase should attend the auction site on the specified date, while observing the following terms of sale:

1.  The Auction Sale Committee has the right to sell the goods in one lot or several lots, depending on the circumstances of the sale.
2.  The successful bidder shall bear a brokerage commission of 2% of the sale price.
3.  The successful bidder must pay the value of the goods only via K-net <orig>الكي نت</orig>, according to the assessment of the Auction Sale Committee.
4.  The successful bidder must remove the goods from the headquarters of the Bait Al-Mal <orig>بيت المال</orig> Control Department urgently and within 5 (five) to 7 (seven) days after the auction is awarded to them, otherwise any goods will be impounded and sold in the next auction if the successful bidder fails to remove them within the specified period.
5.  If the goods are not sold for any reason in the auction, the Committee has the right to offer them for sale in the subsequent auction.
6.  The Administration has the right to stop, postpone, or reschedule the sale to another date if a suitable price is not obtained or for any reasons it deems contrary to its interests.
7.  The Auction Sale Committee may cancel or postpone the auction for any reason it deems fit.
8.  Since the goods will be sold as-is, bidders must inspect them to ascertain the condition, quality, and type of these goods located at the aforementioned address during the auction sale.

# Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>
## Announcement

Regarding the expiration of the initial approval period for establishing a company engaged in securities activities, the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> announces the expiration of the initial approval period granted to the founders of a company under establishment on 2025/04/06, in accordance with Resolution No. (134) of 2024 concerning the initial approval for establishing a closed company engaged in securities activities, issued on 2024/10/07, from the following gentlemen:

| 2   | Seldon Investments Limited (Jordan) Private Shareholding <orig>شركة سيلدون للاستثمارات ليمتد (الأردن) مساهمة خاصة</orig> | 4%        | Jordan <orig>الأردن</orig> |
| 3   | Seldon Investments Limited <orig>شركة سيلدون الفينستيمينس ليمتد</orig> | 4%        | British Virgin Islands <orig>الجزر العذراء البريطانية</orig> |
| 4   | Windsor Brokers International Limited <orig>شركة وندسور بروكرز انترناشونال ليمتد</orig> | 4%        | Seychelles <orig>سيشيل</orig> |
| 5   | Windsor Global Markets Limited <orig>شركة وندسور جلوبال ماركس ليمتد</orig> | 4%        | British Virgin Islands <orig>الجزر العذراء البريطانية</orig> |

Accordingly, the application for licensing securities activities submitted by the aforementioned founders of the company shall be deemed null and void as of the date of expiration of the initial approval on 2025/04/06, in accordance with the provision of Article 1-7 of Book Five (Securities Activities and Registered Persons) of the Executive Regulations of Law No. 7 of 2010 regarding the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activity and their amendments, which stipulates the following:

"
If the applicant fails to submit the required documents and information within the period specified by the Authority in the notification without an acceptable excuse from the Authority, the application shall be deemed null and void.

### Announcement
### Auction No. (8-2023/2022)
The Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig> announces the extension of the closing period for Auction No. (8-2023/2022) for the supply, installation, operation, maintenance, management, and training of the passenger registration and early border security inquiry system at Kuwait International Airport <orig>مطار الكويت الدولي</orig>.
Please note that the final deadline for submitting bids will be at (1:00 PM) on (Wednesday) corresponding to (2025/4/30) instead of (Tuesday) corresponding to (2025/4/15). Any bid submitted after this deadline will be rejected.

### Announcement of Practice Tender No. (45-2024/2025)
Supply and installation of arriving passenger baggage inspection devices at Passenger Terminal T4
The Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig> announces the extension of the closing period for Practice Tender No. (45-2024/2025) related to the supply and installation of arriving passenger baggage inspection devices at Passenger Terminal T4.
Please note that the final deadline for submitting bids will be at (1:00 PM) on (Monday) corresponding to (2025/4/21) instead of (Monday) corresponding to (2025/4/7). Any bid submitted after this deadline will be rejected.

a request for the release of the company's bank guarantees deposited with the Municipality in consideration of its classification.
Based on Article (19) of Municipality Resolution No. (161/2009) <orig>قرار البلدية رقم (2009/161)</orig> concerning the classification, licensing, and registration of building and demolition contractors in Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>, which stipulates that a contractor may submit a request to the Municipality to cancel their registration before its expiry or to cancel the classification, the committee stipulated in Article 1 of this regulation shall issue its decision after fulfilling the following two conditions:
1- The contractor has completed all contracted works.
2- Fifteen (15) days have elapsed from the date of publication of this request in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.
The cancellation of the license or registration entails the refund of the bank guarantee submitted by the contractor, taking into account the last paragraph of Article (10) of this resolution.
Accordingly, the Municipality appeals to anyone who has any claims against the aforementioned contractor regarding building contracts concluded between them that have not yet been completed, or judicial attachments <orig>حجوزات قضائية</orig> in their favor due to violating contracting works or dues arising from the contracting agreement, to review the Contractors Department <orig>قسم المقاولين</orig> at the Engineering Systems Department <orig>إدارة الأنظمة الهندسية</orig> within a maximum period of fifteen days from this date. The Municipality will not consider any claims submitted after the prescribed period.

Director General of the Municipality <orig>مدير عام البلدية</orig>

Further to Kuwait Municipality's <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig> Announcements No. (2023/43) and No. (2023/104) regarding the opening of qualification for companies and establishments undertaking solid municipal waste, construction waste, and asbestos waste <orig>النفايات الأسيسية</orig> transportation works, in accordance with what is stipulated in the qualification booklet prepared for this purpose and Ministerial Decision No. 2023/354 regarding the Bylaw on Municipal Waste Management and Public Cleanliness.

Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig> wishes to remind that it is not permitted to engage in the transportation of solid municipal waste, construction waste, and asbestos waste <orig>النفايات الأسيسية</orig> without obtaining a qualification certificate from the competent committee <orig>اللجنة المختصة</orig>. Violators will be subject to legal liability.

Director General of the Municipality <orig>مدير عام البلدية</orig>

A request has been made for the release of the company's bank guarantees <orig>الكفالات المصرفية</orig> deposited with the Municipality <orig>البلدية</orig> in consideration of its classification.

Based on Article (19) of Municipality Decision No. (2009/161) concerning the classification, licensing, and registration of building and demolition contractors in Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>, which stipulates that a contractor may submit a request to the Municipality <orig>البلدية</orig> to cancel their registration before its expiry or to cancel the classification, and the committee stipulated in Article One of this Bylaw <orig>اللجنة المنصوص عليها بالمادة الأولى من هذه اللائحة</orig> may issue its decision to that effect after fulfilling the following two conditions:
1- The contractor has completed all contracted works.
2- Fifteen (15) days have elapsed from the date of publication of this request in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

The cancellation of the license or registration shall result in the refund of the bank guarantee <orig>الكفالة المصرفية</orig> submitted by the contractor, taking into account the last paragraph of Article (10) of this Decision.

Accordingly, the Municipality <orig>البلدية</orig> appeals to anyone who has any claims against the aforementioned contractor regarding concluded building contracts that have not yet been completed, or judicial attachments in their favor due to violating contracting works or dues arising from the contracting agreement, to review the Contractors Department <orig>قسم المقاولين</orig> at the Engineering Systems Department <orig>إدارة الأنظمة الهندسية</orig> within a maximum period of fifteen days from this date. The Municipality <orig>البلدية</orig> will not consider any claims submitted after the prescribed period.

General Directorate of the National Guard <orig>الرئاسة العامة للحرس الوطني</orig>
Announcement
Issuance of Tender No. (12- 2024/2025)

The Committee for Military Material Purchases and Military Facilities Contracts <orig>لجنة شئون مشتريات المواد العسكرية ومقاولات المنشآت العسكرية</orig> in the National Guard <orig>الحرس الوطني</orig> announces the issuance of a tender for the supply, installation, operation, and maintenance of fiber optic network devices. This is open to specialized companies and establishments in accordance with the general and special conditions stated in the tender documents.
Therefore, companies and establishments wishing to participate in this tender must register on the website of the General Directorate of the National Guard <orig>الرئاسة العامة للحرس الوطني</orig> (www.kng.gov.kw) to purchase the tender documents for a non-refundable fee of (150 K.D.) only, one hundred and fifty Kuwaiti Dinars only, payable through the National Guard's website using the (K-NET) service.
A preliminary meeting will be held at 10:00 AM on Sunday, 20/04/2025, at the General Directorate of the National Guard <orig>الرئاسة العامة للحرس الوطني</orig>, Colonel Staff / Faisal Al-Jareed <orig>العقيد ركن/ فيصل الجريد</orig> Building. Bidders, whether present or absent from this meeting, will be bound by all decisions, recommendations, or clarifications contained therein. Participating companies and establishments must also print the minutes of the preliminary meeting from the National Guard's website (www.kng.gov.kw). Please note that the deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Wednesday, 30/04/2025.
Note: Companies and establishments wishing to purchase tender documents must provide us with a copy of the purchase receipt. Companies classified as small and medium enterprises must bring a certificate proving this. For any inquiries, please call the switchboard at (24999999) extensions (66787-66735) Fax (24999858).

<header>
Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> Issue 1734, Seventy-First Year
163
Sunday, 15 Shawwal 1446 AH - 13/04/2025 AD
</header>
First: Tender documents can be obtained from the Documents and Contracts Department - Third Floor - at the headquarters of the Public Authority for Housing Welfare <orig>المؤسسة العامة للرعاية السكنية</orig> in South Surra <orig>جنوب السرة</orig>, according to the following terms and requirements when purchasing tender documents:
1. Submission of the company's registration certificate with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>. (A recent certificate for the year the tender is issued), and a certificate of accreditation for authorized signatories with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>.
2. Submission of a registration certificate proving the bidder's license from the Ministry of Commerce <orig>وزارة التجارة</orig>, a commercial registration certificate, a registration certificate with the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>, and the company's articles of association with all attached amendments, certified by the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> (for local companies).
3. Submission of a registration certificate issued by the competent authorities in the country to which the foreign bidder belongs, provided that it is certified by the official authorities in the country of establishment and attested by a Kuwaiti consulate or any other entity authorized to certify the company, along with a copy of its articles of association, including all attached amendments, all of which must be in either Arabic or English, legally notarized, and certified by official authorities.
4. Submission of a valid national labor percentage fulfillment certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> (for local companies).
5. Tender documents shall be handed over against a non-refundable amount as specified in the table above, by certified check issued in favor of the Public Authority for Housing Welfare <orig>المؤسسة العامة للرعاية السكنية</orig> or K-Net card.
6. Submission of a letter of authorization from the company in the name of the authorized person to purchase tender documents, along with a copy of the civil ID of the same authorized person and a signature accreditation certificate.
7. Companies that have received a valid penalty in state tenders and projects will not be allowed to participate.
8. Companies that have ongoing contracts (under execution) with the Authority and are delayed in delivering any part of the project beyond the contractual completion date by a delay percentage exceeding (50%) of the total contract duration will not be allowed to apply for a new tender until the contract under execution is settled.
9. The deadline for submitting inquiries about the above-mentioned tender is 01/05/2025, provided they are submitted in Arabic (inquiries should be submitted to the Documents and Contracts Department, Third Floor, at the headquarters of the Public Authority for Housing Welfare <orig>المؤسسة العامة للرعاية السكنية</orig> in South Surra <orig>جنوب السرة</orig>). No questions or inquiries received by the Authority after this date will be considered.

Second: The following conditions must be adhered to when submitting the bid:
1. The deadline for submitting bids (closing) is 1:00 PM at the headquarters of the Public Authority for Housing Welfare <orig>المؤسسة العامة للرعاية السكنية</orig> - South Surra <orig>جنوب السرة</orig> - Documents and Contracts Department - Third Floor.
2. Submission of proof that the company has executed and completed works similar to the tender works (required and whose controls are specified in item Third: Foundations and Criteria) as a main contractor during the last fifteen years (from the date of preliminary handover of the project), along with a copy of the contract and a certificate of work completion issued by the contracting entity.
3. The bidder must attach a clearance certificate stating that there are no impediments related to the labor registered with them at the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, in accordance with Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> Circular No. (2) for the year 2021, issued on 26/01/2021 (for local companies).
4. Submission of a letter of authorization from the company in the name of the authorized person to submit the bid, along with a copy of the civil ID of the same authorized person and a signature accreditation certificate.
5. The bidder must attach with their bid the preliminary bond in their name in favor of the Public Authority for Housing Welfare <orig>المؤسسة العامة للرعاية السكنية</orig> in the form of a guarantee letter issued in Arabic, unconditional, free of any reservations, payable on demand, issued by a bank accredited in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, and valid throughout the bid validity period, and for the value specified in the tender announcement. The bidder is not entitled to cancel it or have it seized by their creditors or claim any interest on it. Cash bonds are not accepted, and any bid not accompanied by the preliminary bond shall be excluded.
6. The authorized representative of the company shall place all tender documents, all required documents in full, as well as qualification documents, in their designated envelopes according to the instructions in the documents and the tender announcement, and seal them with red wax. Then, they must personally, and under their own responsibility, place the first envelope [Bid Submission Envelope] in the designated box, which contains:
    - Bid form and total bid value (original copies), fully completed, stamped, and signed.
    - Preliminary bond (preliminary guarantee)
    - Valid national labor percentage fulfillment certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, noting that bids not including this certificate will be excluded (for local companies).
    - Company's articles of association and a registration certificate issued by the competent authorities in the country to which it belongs, stamped and signed by the official authorities in the country of establishment, and attested by a Kuwaiti consulate or any other entity authorized to certify (valid).

Third: Qualification Documents (Foundations and Criteria):
The bidder is obligated to submit all required documents proving their fulfillment of all terms and requirements under the Foundations and Criteria along with the bid documents, and place them inside the envelopes designated for the Foundations and Criteria requirements as follows:
Required Technical Documents: -
(1) The bidder must meet any of the following conditions: -
    - The bidder must have completed as a main contractor, within the last (15) years, contract/contracts (supply and installation) of no less than (3) main substations with a voltage of (132 kV) or higher in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> (under the supervision of the Ministry of Electricity, Water and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig>), provided that the substations are (Indoor Substation) and include SF6 gas-insulated switchgear and no less than (2) power transformers with a capacity of (30 MVA) or higher each.
    Or
    - The bidder must have completed as a main contractor, within the last (15) years, contract/contracts (supply and installation) of no less than (5) main substations with a voltage of (132 kV) or higher in the Gulf Cooperation Council <orig>مجلس التعاون الخليجي</orig> countries (under the supervision of relevant governmental energy authorities), provided that the substations are (Indoor Substation) and include SF6 gas-insulated switchgear and no less than (2) power transformers with a capacity of (30 MVA) or higher each.
    Or
    - The bidder must have completed as a main contractor, within the last (15) years, contract/contracts (supply and installation) of no less than (10) main substations with a voltage of (132 kV) or higher (under the supervision of relevant governmental energy authorities or the end-user if the bid/substations are outside the Gulf Cooperation Council <orig>مجلس التعاون الخليجي</orig> countries, and no less than half the number (5) substations) that have been executed outside these countries, and provided that the substations are (Indoor Substation) and include SF6 gas-insulated switchgear and no less than (2) power transformers with a capacity of (30 MVA) or higher each.

- The bidder must have completed, as a main contractor, within the last (15) years, contract(s) (supply and installation) for at least (1) main substation with a voltage of (275 kV) or higher in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> (under the supervision of the Ministry of Electricity, Water and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig>), provided that the substations are (Indoor Substation) and include SF6 gas-insulated switchgear and at least (2) power transformers with a capacity of (300 MVA) or higher each.

Or

- The bidder must have completed, as a main contractor, within the last (15) years, contract(s) (supply and installation) for at least (2) main substations with a voltage of (275 kV) or higher in the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) <orig>مجلس التعاون الخليجي</orig> countries (under the supervision of the relevant governmental energy authorities), provided that the substations are (Indoor Substation) and include SF6 gas-insulated switchgear and at least (2) power transformers with a capacity of (300 MVA) or higher each.
(2) The main contractor shall submit the contract document signed with the entity, and the acceptance certificate or completion certificate for the station(s) issued by the relevant governmental energy authorities or by the end-user if the station(s) are outside the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) countries, provided that no more than (15) years have passed since the issuance of the certificate.
(3) The main contractor shall submit a client certificate issued by the relevant governmental energy authorities or by the end-user if the station(s) are outside the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) countries, proving that the station(s) have been in service for at least one year from the date of operation.

Financial Documents:
- The company's capital must not be less than one million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> or its equivalent in other currencies, supported by documentary evidence.
- The company must submit full financial statements (income statement, balance sheet, and cash flow statement) for the last (3) years, certified by an auditing firm and attested by the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
- The company must submit certificates from the banks it deals with, indicating its financial standing and the banks' willingness to provide facilities to it, provided that the certificates are valid and issued within the year of the tender submission.
These will be subject to financial study and analysis to assess financial capability.

ISO Certificates:
- A valid (ISO9001) certificate confirming the bidder's compliance with the standard quality management system.
- A valid (ISO14001) certificate confirming the bidder's compliance with the environmental management system.

Fourth: Rules and Conditions:
1. The bidder must submit (2) original hard copies of the bills of quantities.
And (3) CD copies of all required documents.
2. If any of the required documents are issued by an entity outside the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, they must be attested by all official authorities, by the Embassy of the State of Kuwait <orig>سفارة دولة الكويت</orig> in the country of origin of the documents, and by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزارة الخارجية</orig> in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, and translated into Arabic by a certified translation office in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>.
3. All documents and data submitted by companies and establishments must be clear and sequential.
4. The Public Authority for Housing Welfare (PAHW) <orig>المؤسسة العامة للرعاية السكنية</orig> has the right to request any original copy to verify its conformity with the attached document copies.
5. The bidder must submit a declaration and undertaking regarding the accuracy of the information and data provided with the bid submission.
6. The company is committed to filling out the table and submitting all required documents with the bid papers. In case of failure to meet any of the required clauses or documents, the Authority has the right to disqualify the bid.
7. In implementation and application of Article (25) of the Authority's Tenders Regulations, and Article (59) of Law No. (49) of 2016 <orig>القانون رقم (49) لسنة 2016</orig> regarding Public Tenders, the Authority has the right not to award more than one tender from Tenders No. (PAHW/1442, PAHW/1279) to a single bidder, in accordance with the requirements of public interest. In this case, the Authority has the right to accept subsequent bids for the execution of the tenders at the lowest price offered in the subsequent bids after excluding the bidder to whom one of the two tenders was awarded.
Bidders submitting their bids in the aforementioned tenders acknowledge their full and unconditional acceptance and acknowledgment of any decisions taken by the Authority in any form whatsoever, without any liability on the Authority in this regard.
8. All technical, financial, and legal documents will be subject to a study to determine their compliance with the tender participation conditions, and the Public Authority for Housing Welfare (PAHW) <orig>المؤسسة العامة للرعاية السكنية</orig> has the right to disqualify any bid if it does not meet the tender conditions and requirements.

Fifth: This announcement is considered an integral part of the tender documents.

These tests must be accredited by an international laboratory in an (STL) organization, and the certificate issuance date must not exceed five years up to the tender closing date, as part of the bid documents.
a) In case the bid submission period expires, the bidder is obligated to submit a letter of undertaking to provide this certificate within two months from the contract signing date.

Financial Documents:
- The company's capital must not be less than one million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> or its equivalent in other currencies, supported by documentary evidence.
- The company must submit complete financial statements (income statement, balance sheet, cash flow statement) for the last (3) years, certified by an auditing firm and attested by the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.

Bidders submitting their bids in the aforementioned tenders acknowledge and fully and unconditionally accept any decisions made by the Corporation <orig>المؤسسة</orig> in any form, without any liability on the Corporation <orig>المؤسسة</orig> in this regard.

The Public Authority for Housing Welfare <orig>المؤسسة العامة للرعاية السكنية</orig> has the right to reject any application if it does not meet the tender conditions.

  - Bid format approved by the bidder.
  - Price lists and bills of quantities.
  - Any other elements that may affect the financial value of the offer in accordance with the terms of the tender.
  - Any other documents or data required by the practice documents.

### Financial Documents:
- The company's capital must not be less than one million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> or its equivalent in other currencies, supported by documentary evidence.
- The company must submit complete financial statements (income statement, balance sheet, cash flow statement) for the company for the last (3) years, certified by an auditing firm and attested by the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
- The company must provide certificates from the banks with which the bidder deals, indicating its financial standing and the banks' willingness to provide facilities to it, provided that the certificates are valid and issued within the year of the tender's offering.
- And will be subject to financial study and analysis to assess financial capability.
- ISO Certificates:
  - Valid (ISO9001) certificate confirming the bidder's compliance with the standard quality management system.
  - Valid (ISO14001) certificate confirming the bidder's compliance with the environmental management system.

### Fourth: Rules and Conditions:
1. The bidder must submit (2) original hard copies of the bills of quantities and (3) CD copies of all required documents.
2. If any of the required documents are issued by an entity outside the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, they must be attested by all official authorities, by the Embassy of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> in the country of origin of the documents, and by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزارة الخارجية</orig> in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, and translated into Arabic by an accredited translation office in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>.
3. All documents and data submitted by companies and institutions must be clear and sequential.
4. The Public Authority for Housing Welfare <orig>المؤسسة العامة للرعاية السكنية</orig> has the right to request any original copy to verify its conformity with the attached document copies.
5. The bidder must submit a declaration and undertaking regarding the accuracy of the information and data provided with the bid.
6. The company is obligated to fill out the table and submit all required documents with the bid papers. In case of non-fulfillment of any of the above-mentioned items or required documents, the Foundation has the right to exclude the bid.

### Location
Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig> - Main Building located South Surra <orig>جنوب السرة</orig> - Ministries Area <orig>منطقة الوزارات</orig> - Block 1, Plot 900023

### Phone No.: 1810000, Sixth Floor.

### Review Times
From (8:30) AM until (01:00) PM.

### Booklet Purchase Fee
(-/75 K.D.) Seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only – non-refundable –

### Conditions Required for the Bidder:
1. Must have previous experience in providing the service subject of the bid for no less than three years in similar governmental entities.
2. The bidder must provide a detailed record of the works undertaken by them as required, supported by authenticated certificates from the relevant authorities.
3. Must have a qualified team with professional experience and full knowledge of the nature of the required work.

### Required Documents:
1. A letter of authorization to purchase the general and special terms booklet for this practice for the person present to purchase it, along with a copy of their civil ID, and approved by the authorized signatory of the company, with a letter of accreditation of the company's authorized signatory, approved by the Central Tenders Committee <orig>هيئة المناقصات المركزية</orig>.
2. Fax number for any inquiries related to the Purchasing Committee at Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig>.
3. A recent and contemporary copy of the certificate of registration with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>.
4. A recent copy of the practice offering announcement.
5. A recent and contemporary copy of the certificate determining the national labor percentage issued by the competent authority.
6. A recent and contemporary copy of the company's commercial register certificate.
7. A recent and contemporary copy of the certificate proving registration with the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة صناعة الكويت</orig>.
8. A copy of a recent and contemporary certificate of registration with the Central Agency for Information Technology <orig>الجهاز المركزي لتكنولوجيا المعلومات</orig>.
